<h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to be part of creating an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Quality Manager<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> The Operations Technician will use Manufacturing\u002FQuality concepts to ensure manufacturing quality and help improve yield of the assigned production line. Candidate must also be able to verify that incoming and\u002For in-process material meets specifications. Responsible for the inspection of material, the documentation of defective material, data collection, and reporting. Candidate will also conduct audits ensuring that tools &amp; equipment are properly calibrated, BOM verification, and processes are followed per documented work instructions. The Operations Technician will work closely with Manufacturing and Quality Engineering to provide reports, charts, graphs etc. to monitor and improve product quality.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Assemble prototype and production products<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with Engineer to create Work Instruction, Quality check List<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist engineers in developing, building, or testing prototypes or new products, processes, or procedures<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Inspect, test all products from our assembly line and RMA<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform in-coming, in-process, and final inspection<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Sort and contain parts effectively and efficiently when issues arise<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Collect data to assist in Manufacturing\u002FQuality improvement activities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Conduct audits and support corrective actions.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>3 - 5 years' experience in a Manufacturing Quality Control environment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge and direct experience in manufacturing operations, NPI, quality inspections and electromechanical products.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Understanding of outsourcing activities with local and international contract manufacturers.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in DFx methodologies.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Able to perform root cause analysis and resolve problems on a conceptual and advanced troubleshooting level.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to read and interpret basic mechanical drawings and electrical schematics.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with high power AC and DC products a plus.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience using DMMs and mechanical inspection tools.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Flexibility and adaptability to work in a dynamic startup environment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Written and spoken English proficiency required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to lift 30 lbs.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $60,000 to $72,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to be part of creating an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Reports to<\u002Fb>: Sr Director, Brand and Corp Marketing<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What you will be doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> The ChargePoint product portfolio encompasses a broad integrated set of hardware, software and services. Working closely with the senior director, the brand manager will help express brand DNA consistently throughout the portfolio and general business activities. This role is highly cross-functional, working with in-house creatives in our marketing, product, and engineering teams. The ideal candidate has a strong grounding in graphic design, understands brand as a corporate asset, and is adept at interpreting and applying brand guidelines to both new and evolving use cases.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What you will bring to ChargePoint <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>Responsibilities<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Review and advise on usage of ChargePoint brand assets by internal groups and external parties such as customers, channel partners, industry organizations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Consult on co-branding across a variety of integration, partnership and sponsorship contexts; primarily digital applications but also physical<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Help assess developing business needs and make recommendations on new brand assets or guidelines<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Help on-board and guide external creative agencies<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p> Qualifications<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Design (or related) degree or certificate<\u002Fli> \n  <li>5 yrs experience in marketing<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong organizational and cross-functional collaboration skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficiency with core Adobe Creative Suite<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficiency with core Microsoft Office tools, Box, and Confluence<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Tech industry preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with digital campaigns preferred<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $70,000 to $122,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Senior Director, Fleet Partnerships<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> The National Fleet Account Manager, Emerging Technology, role is on the leading edge developing innovative solutions to support North America EV Fleet. This dynamic sales and development leader will manage and penetrate segments like Ride Share, Autonomous, eVTOL, off-road vehicles and many other exciting areas for EV solutions. This business development role will work cross-functionally alongside technical engineers, solutions engineers and other team leaders to develop solutions that are scalable and position ChargePoint to be successful. The success of early EV adoption is highly dependent on strong relationships and expertise in EV products and services. This is a great opportunity for personal growth in the EV Fleet industry.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Develop and Grow assigned Book of Business and utilize National\u002FLocal Sales team and leadership to assist customers with their electrification plans.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strategize complex problems and present solutions that scale for all segments of fleet customers developing emerging technologies.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Interact with OEM's and infrastructure partners to assist customers in deployment and integration of electric charging and fleet tools.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist customers with grants and incentives to utilize all programs available at the Federal, State and Utilities level.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with customers to solution financing options if needed and provide guidance on best charging financing solutions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Create clear documentation of interactions, activities, detailed qualification notes, and recommendations for next steps.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist with the continual improvement and delivery of strong day- to-day processes and systems for lead generation.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Help develop efficient use of salesforce.com and the appropriate automation of process.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide marketing materials on company products and services to book of business customers.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with the Sales and Marketing teams to assist in the follow-up activities related to specific marketing campaigns and webinars.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Bachelor's degree or equivalent required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Previous sales experience prospecting or managing a book of business.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>8+ years of channel\u002Fsales experience (automotive and fleet experience is a plus)\\<\u002Fli> \n  <li>The position holder must be a self-starter and able to work hard, independently.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated ability to interact and communicate effectively and professionally internally and externally.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven ability to multi-task and willingness to work to the benefit of others.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment and deliver on commitments.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Desire to grow beyond current role, regardless of function.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A passion to disrupt the traditional automotive industry by helping promote the EV industry.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimal travel expected for this role (less than four trips per year).<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>US Remote<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to be part of creating an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Vice President of Manufacturing, Quality &amp; Technical Operations<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What you will bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> The Director of Product Quality will provide leadership, operational excellence in execution and strategic direction our product quality organization. Be the lead voice and advocates of customer and operator for our core lines of products and services. Work closely with cross functional leaders in product management, sales product design, system engineering, regulatory\u002Fcompliance, customer support, product operations and supply chain teams to ensure the product represents and supports the very best of the ChargePoint brand. Successful candidate at ChargePoint must be highly motivated, self-directed, and comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Undisputed voice for operations and our customers.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop, lead and scale an industry leading quality team including quality controls and processes, quality engineering, quality assurance and quality systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Establish quality initiatives and program that ensures class leading solution to accelerate our fleet, commercial and consumer base lines of business support and management<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Directs and lead all aspects of the quality planning processes; participates in strategic and tactical planning processes that balances budgetary and resource allocation<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develops strategies to ensure safe and efficient operations of our product lines<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lead Risk Management and Mitigation initiatives<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lead communication and report regularly to management and key internal \u002F external stakeholders on key quality systems, metrics, and customer focus areas<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintain and ensure there are no significant interruptions to the business due to quality or compliance\u002Fregulatory issues<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Establish and scale our quality capabilities to appropriately manage our ever growing supply chain to ensure we have a robust and closed loop process to effectively handle product, part and service issue and disruptions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Establish and develop advance quality activities such as: DFM, vendor selection, establishing quality criteria and goals, FMEA\u002FPFMEA, and defining validation and reliability test requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage and scale up our world wide quality and process audits of new and current suppliers<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Establish class-leading field failure analysis and capabilities with our worldwide network of users, supplier, resellers and service providers.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Establish class-leading vendor development\u002Fmanagement\u002Fmonitoring to support our worldwide supply chain and fulfillment network.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Establish with our suppliers a comprehensive dashboard that will actively collect, extrapolate and analyze quality and manufacturing yield data.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Present this data at cross functional forums and meetings.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with suppliers, vendors and partners to define and implement robust incoming, in-process and out-going quality control processes<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Collaborates across ChargePoint's internal and external organization across functional groups and geographic locations. This includes but not limited to customers, partners, suppliers and executive management.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Qualifications and Desired Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Minimum B.S. (M.S. preferred) in Mechanical, Electrical, or Industrial Engineering related field<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 12-15 years' experience working in mfg. engineering, test engineering and\u002For quality management and systems and power electronics roles<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Solid knowledge of stand-alone to multi-unit system manufacturing and field integration concepts and methodologies.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in developing and implementing scaled solutions to adequately support measurement and inspection processes, tools, fixtures, and gages at our various tiers of supply chain and associated quality requirement to work in concert and in a seamless fashion.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Solid understanding of and experience applying problem solving tools including root cause analysis, statistical tools and processes, and design of experiments.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to clearly summarize quality data and trends and to create reports and presentations for all levels of internal and external audiences.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Able to establish product and platform level solutions and guidelines while guiding the team from the ground up<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with Lean or Six Sigma programs and Statistical Quality Control processes and systems.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with Lean or Six Sigma programs and Statistical Quality Control processes and systems.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $147,000 to $224,000. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Manager, Incentive Program Strategy, Customer Solutions<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Engage with internal and external stakeholders on the design and implementation of large incentive programs which seeks to enable the deployment of EVSE infrastructure projects across North America.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Analyze potential charging locations and forecast driver utilization levels by leveraging existing data from the ChargePoint network, understanding of the use case and business dynamics at the site, nearby charging alternatives, local\u002Fregional dynamics, traffic patterns and other geospatial information related to the site.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Evaluate site host properties for the proper placement of EV chargers, considering factors such as site host preferences, where electricity is distributed onto the property, how close electrical supply is to areas under consideration for EV charger installation, availability of electrical capacity to serve the project, safety, driver experience, accessibility requirements etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Engage with large, multi-site property owners and businesses to pitch electric vehicle deployment strategies that span a variety of property types and business models.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate budget proposals through a network of installation partners which may include site walks to guide cost effective and expedient site builds.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review financial models and work with customers or potential site hosts to clearly articulate the business case or impacts of owning or hosting fast chargers at their sites.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Build supporting documentation and prescriptive project narratives required for successful grant applications.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Present and negotiate terms for site host agreements, getting to contract closure in a timely manner to meet program deadlines.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with internal legal counsel and property owners to negotiate and close site agreements.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Present and provide potential site hosts and customers with hosting proposals and product\u002Fproject\u002Fsupport service materials.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Record and track milestones to ensure projects are completed in a timely manner<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate and manage construction contractors. This includes cost negotiation, contract management, communication, and coordination of project activities. Scheduled weekly meetings and diligent follow-ups are required to ensure construction related activities advance at all locations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate and manage relationships with key contracts at partner electric utilities and grant administrators. Scheduled weekly meetings and diligent follow-ups are required to ensure projects meet milestone deadlines.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide the team with weekly updates on the pipeline in individual geographic territories.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>This role requires at least 10% travel, mostly by car.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>You have a passion for vehicle electrification with a good knowledge of the automotive industry and electric vehicle charging dynamics<\u002Fli> \n  <li>5+ years' experience in sales and project management, preferably in electrical and civil infrastructure deployment on commercial properties or related infrastructure deployment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven track record of closing deals with both small business owners and large, multinational properties<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work remotely, effectively work under tight deadlines and manage projects independently<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A diligent reporter that takes time to document activities with a proficiency using tracking tools such as SalesForce.com and other project tracking <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to be part of creating an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Vice President, Services Operations<\u002Fp> \n <p> The Process Excellence Project Manager will drive operational excellence with the services organization, cross-functional teams and business applications in the North American or EU region. The main goal is to improve and maintain efficient and profitable operations that also produce the highest quality of products and services.<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Assist in developing and implementing process improvements to meet business goals. This includes acting as project manager for the business side of the initiative and work closely with the business application project manager<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Identity and manage resources for process improvement projects.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist in planning and executing process improvement projects.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide support and guidance to team when needed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provides consultation on the use of re-engineering techniques to improve process performance and product quality.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist in developing process improvement policies and infrastructure.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Optimize or redesign process flows to meet project requirements.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintain and update all process related documents for reference purposes.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Train resources in process improvement techniques.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Monitor process performance and improvements in key metrics.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with management to define the short-term and long-term objectives and potential gains.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist in determining project scope and schedule based on business needs and customer requirements.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Evaluating, in detail, a current operation from start to finish<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Analyzing this information to find areas of waste, duplication, and frequent errors<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Developing a plan to implement changes<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Monitoring the results of the changes to ensure they are working<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Making continuous improvements and adjustments to maintain efficient operations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Analytical skills for troubleshooting designs not working as planned, asking the right questions, and finding answers that work<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor's degree in a business or technology related field or equivalent combination of education and experience.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>8 years' experience in a process improvement capacity with increasing responsibilities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven track record of driving results in both back-office case-management and change management for employees.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated skills in leadership, negotiation, problem solving, conflict management, planning, and delegating<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office products, familiar with Salesforce, CRM, and case management systems. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles (EVs) expected to be nearly 20% of new vehicle sales by 2025 across North America and Europe, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint is at the center of this revolution, powering the world's leading EV charging network and most complete set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every EV charging need. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a reality globally.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Recently listed on the NYSE (CHPT) and supported by $660 million since inception from investors including Daimler, Siemens, Linse Capital, Rho Capital Partners, BMW i Ventures and Braemar Energy Ventures, ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to be part of creating an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market. Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come<\u002Fp> \n <p> Reports To:<\u002Fp> \n <p> Job Title: Program Manager, Fleet Support Programs<\u002Fp> \n <p> Reports To: Fleet Support PMO Head<\u002Fp> \n <p> Location: North America<\u002Fp> \n <p> The <b><i>Program Manager, Fleet Support Programs <\u002Fi><\u002Fb>will work with internal and external stakeholders to ensure project delivery and premium customer support to a portfolio of key, fleet clients. The Program Manager will closely manage and control the EV solution and support implementation as detailed in a Statement of Work. In addition to customer facing responsibilities, the Program Manager will interface cross-functionally to ensure comprehensive, seamless, end-to-end solution delivery. <b>This role requires traveling to client sites about 10% of the time.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Act as primary liaison between the Support staff and Account resolve<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage and coordinate a group of related projects having high risk and complexity in order to maximize benefits and control parameters<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participate in the <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Sr. Director, Global People Operations.<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> The Sr. Employee Relations Consultant will lead the employee relations function at ChargePoint and will provide guidance to management and the People team in the resolution of all performance management and employee relations issues, including complex, escalated and sensitive employee relations issues. The ER consultant seeks to analyze, investigate, and guide the resolution in a timely manner that seeks to promote a respectful workplace culture (e. g., guidance on employment law; investigations of inappropriate conduct or policy violations. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Key responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Conduct timely and thorough internal investigations of all issues and complaints raised, documents findings, work with HR\u002Flegal and make recommendations to management as appropriate.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Help set up the Employee Relations function at ChargePoint by developing, implementing, and administering employee relations policies, procedures, and best practices to create a positive working environment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coach, guide and influence managers and leaders regarding critical and complex employee relations decisions. Partner with stakeholders and Legal team to review and make recommendations on complex issues, such as terminations, investigations, and medical issues\u002Faccommodations, to ensure consistency in how issues are approached and handled and effectively manage risk.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Stay current on employment law and employment law trends<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Tracks trends in various types of employee relations cases to proactively identify issues and develop strategies to address root cause.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Point of escalation for policy interpretations, clarification, and recommendations for updates and changes<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> The Sr. Employee Relations Consultant is responsible for providing advice and counsel to leaders, managers and employees on a variety of employee relations and management issues.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> The individual in this role must have strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills and the ability to communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders at all levels. The individual must also be able to work independently and support multiple projects in a high volume, fast-paced environment. Additionally, the individual must be flexible, agile, and able to collaborate in a hybrid\u002Fvirtual environment.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Basic qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>10+ years of Employee Relations experience with at least 3 years leading the function.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Expert knowledge of employment, wage and hour, FMLA and EEO laws<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Outstanding skills in conflict resolution, counselling, coaching, negotiations, risk management, and building relationships with employees at all levels<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong analytical skills to identify trends and interpret information.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>BA\u002FBS degree or equivalent work experience<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Preferred qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Solid understanding of general HR principles and policies<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent investigation and documentation skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong analytical skills and ability to exercise sound judgment based on policies, procedures, practices, risk factors and precedent<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Exceptional communication skills with a high degree of attention to detail. Experience handling sensitive matters with tact &amp; diplomacy<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Resourceful, with ability to work as a self-starter in a face paced, flexible environment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to act with sense of urgency, while maintaining accuracy &amp; data integrity<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong project management &amp; organization skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in high growth, fast-paced company a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiarity with UltiPro, Workday desired<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Bay Area preferred (hybrid)<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $70,000 to $122,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to be part of creating an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Vice President Global Services Operations<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> ChargePoint is looking for an experienced professional to support our Strategic Sourcing and Management of service partners in North America. You will be responsible for recruiting top service partners and onboarding them, this includes Construction, Engineering, Commissioning, and Operations and Maintenance Partners. In this role you will work closely with our internal functional teams in these areas to insure we have the right partners at the right time to insure ChargePoint delivers world-class services to our customers. You will also work with ChargePoint channel and product teams to create and develop strategic partner collaborations and work with ChargePoint Sales to insure a robust services referral network. You will also be responsible for enablement programs that support the large network of partners that sell construction and O&amp;M services directly to our customers.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Supports Design &amp; Build, Commissioning, and O&amp;M<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage the funnel of potential partners through onboarding<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Create Partner strategy by coordinating with Channel Management, Design &amp;Build, Field Quality and Field Service<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develops tools, processes and executes Partner recruitment in coordination with Channel Team \n   <ul>\n    <li>Tradeshows, journals, marketing<\u002Fli> \n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li>Negotiate and manages MSAs (Master Service Agreements) to insure best terms and prices with partners and manage compliance<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develops and Manages partner score-carding<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develops communication channels and tools to enhance perceived value of being a ChargePoint Partner<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate with Design &amp; Build, Field Quality, and Field Service to use Partners to deploy world class services whether sold by CP or through referral<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with Channels team to create incentive programs to motivate and reward partners<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage contractor compliance with HSE and respond to customer documentation requirements in this area<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage contractor compliance with public works regulations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Training Plans and Management<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Escalation point for partners (ex. AP issues, process improvements)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with product mgmt. to define program parameters for new service products both short term and long term<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>10+ years of experience in managing partners in construction or O&amp;M<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Highly proficient in all stages of the sourcing lifecycle in the construction and O&amp;M categories<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven ability to develop true service partners as opposed to just vendors<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience working extensively cross-functionally<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient in multiple Business Applications<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong negotiation and conflict resolution skills.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Willingness to travel ~30%<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $132,000 to $210,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Senior Partner Account Manager<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> ChargePoint is seeking an experienced Electrical Distribution Partner Account Manager with a positive track record of managing a mature distribution eco-system. This full-time position will drive the adoption of ChargePoint EVSE solutions with electrical distributors and customers. You will be a critical member of the channel organization, developing strategy and leading the implementation of sales plans, promotions, and stocking programs.<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Educate partners and their customers on EV market and charging solutions<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lead and attend sales calls on electrical distributors in defined territory<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Build relationships with defined electrical distribution branches<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Recruit, onboard and support electrical distributors in defined territory<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Contract initiation, negotiation, &amp; execution<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Create growth-oriented sales plans for new and existing channel partners<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work closely with management and other analysts on important business issues &amp; projects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist with sales operations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure collaboration between the different ecosystem players<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide ongoing reporting &amp; transparency<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Drive and report pipeline &amp; revenue on a weekly\u002Fmonthly\u002Fquarterly basis<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to travel as much as 60% of the time, Southwest and Northwest regions.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Must have experience working with electrical contractors and working knowledge of the construction industry<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Can work both independently and with others, face-to-face and remotely<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent computer skills with proficiency in the use of Windows Applications: Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint &amp; Word<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent communication skills, and must be able to easily interact with people in either oral (including semi-formal presentation) or written form<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Salesforce proficiency preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Collaborative team player<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bridge gap between industry &amp; technology<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Start-up and get things done mentality<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>10+ years distribution sales\u002Fmanagement experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bachelors degree or equivalent<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Track record of developing strategic partnerships and alliances on an enterprise level<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Practical experience within the electrical distribution community.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent communication and presentation skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong analytical skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Self-motivated, strong execution capability, thoughtful and passionate<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>US Remote \u002F Western territory (NV, NM, AZ, CO, UT,WY, WA, OR, ID, MO)<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p>ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $58,000 to $120,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Manager, Product Operations<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is seeking a process and systems-oriented Product Operations Manager to join our growing team. The Product Operations team is responsible for designing, deploying, and scaling processes and tools that enable successful product launches, geographical and market expansions, new vertical launches, and other business critical initiatives. A Product Operations Manager may find themselves doing any of the following at ChargePoint: Leading cross-functional teams through sound lifecycle management practices to ensure smooth product launches and product transitions<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Developing innovative solutions with Product and cross-functional leadership to deliver into new and emerging market opportunities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Architecting new business systems and product conventions that scale and increase ChargePoint's product deployment velocity<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Increasing cross-functional visibility, alignment, and commitment to action for new initiatives. Aligning ChargePoint stakeholders on product roadmaps, resource commitments, progress tracking, and product success<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>2+ years of program-level decision-making experience in product management, program management, operations, or equivalent<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Hands-on knowledge of go-to-market, new product introductions or other product lifecycle transitions<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A customer-centric, generalized solution-oriented mindset<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiarity with how processes, tools, and people come together successfully (and unsuccessfully)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced, matrixed-team environment, interacting across seniority levels<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Outstanding track record building relationships and influencing without formal authority+ Fluency in data handling and project management tools such as Confluence, JIRA, and Tableau<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Passionate about ChargePoint and our mission.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Exceptional written and verbal communications skills.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bachelor of Science (B.S.) degree preferred.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $70,000 to $163,000. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities, and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets, and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to be part of creating an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Vice President, Employee Experience<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Reporting to the VP Employee Experience, this full-time position will collaborate closely with assigned leaders, managers, employees, and the global people team members to deliver global people strategies and initiatives that enable business success and growth.<\u002Fp> \n <p> This role is both a strategic partner and someone who is equally comfortable rolling up their sleeves to get the work done. The Sr. HRBP will consult with key stakeholders to design and embed effective people practices for assigned client groups, including talent management, succession planning, engagement survey analysis and action planning, goal setting and cascade process, rewards planning, organization and team development, diversity initiatives, employee relations, employee and leadership development, culture, and values work. In this role, you will partner with COEs and global People team members in designing and rolling out innovative and impactful programs and practices to drive an overall amazing Employee Experience, as well as build connectivity and engagement strategies that are anchored in ChargePoint's values and support our growing workforce. You will join us at a critical time in our growth and help design and build foundational People programs to enable us to inspire, engage, develop, and grow our employees and leaders around the world. The ideal candidate will have experience at high growth, fast-paced companies, driving transformational change.<\u002Fp> \n <p> This role will require you to be highly organized, detail-oriented, hard-working, and able to prioritize effectively. Additionally, you will need to be versatile and able to work independently as well as work with others at all levels of our fast-paced organization, globally. We are a very lean team that works collaboratively to help improve the employee experience and support the leaders, and you will play a key role in executing our future people strategy and programs in a creative, innovative, and agile manner.<\u002Fp> \n <p> In our performance and results driven culture, we want to bring on a top-notch HRBP that will bring the right energy and a have proven track record tackling high-impact initiatives with a demonstrated collaborative attitude and experience working across functional areas on a wide range of topics. We are at the forefront of a revolution in electric mobility, so the right candidate should have a clear passion for culture and the people initiatives that will enable our talented workforce to thrive. This person is motivated, a self-starter and quick learner who brings energy and excitement to every project sent their way.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Duties and Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Engage with assigned executives and their leadership teams to translate business strategy into talent, engagement and people strategies that drive goal achievement<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Advise key leaders and related partners on people programs and processes that enable the business to achieve its strategy and growth plans<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lead or participate in the design and delivery of programs and services from the People function to achieve function priorities and operational requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lead organization design and effectiveness reviews and changes and\u002F or interventions as required, to build capability, drive sustainable change &amp; enhance business results<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide agile, creative, and holistic solutions to people &amp; business challenges<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with leaders to drive organizational, team and individual performance in alignment with our values and culture<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Leverage data and analytics to diagnose challenges and provide practical solutions<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participate in and lead programs and initiatives (e.g., compensation planning, leadership development, workforce planning, and organizational change) for assigned client organizations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Consult with employees and managers to address root causes of people issues, attempting to resolve employee relations issues with a systematic approach<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Keep pace with best practices and provide thoughtful recommendations anchored in analytics and geared to achieve desired outcomes.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Leverage strong coaching and motivational skills to develop and advise executive leadership<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participate in global cross-functional people team projects<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Requirements and Success Factors<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor's degree or equivalent in HR, Business, or related field; MBA or Master's degree in HR\u002FOD preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>8+ years of experience as an HR Business partner<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Capability to assess an organization, identify gaps, and develop solutions in collaboration with global team members and centers of excellence such as compensation, learning and development, staffing, security, and legal.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Comfort focusing on the future while managing day-to-day matters.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to remain calm under pressure while managing various high-priority projects simultaneously.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to successfully work across multiple time zones, as needed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Pragmatic problem-solver who leverages analytic reasoning and business acumen to identify and implement solutions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent relationship building and people skills; expertise in partnering with and influencing executive-level leaders, cross-departmental teams and stakeholders and employees.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong active-listening skills and ability to exercise discretion when dealing with sensitive topics.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong project and change management skills.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing demands.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Self-starter with a positive and professional approach.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>FUN Brings energy, passion, and a can-do attitude to everything you do.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Willing\u002Fable to travel occasionally.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Full time position in Campbell, CA or Remote (West Coast preferred)<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $85,000 to $124,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Position Summary<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> The Utility Partnerships Manager is responsible for executing on business and market development objectives to promote ChargePoint's network and products and advance transportation electrification throughout North America. Must be goal-motivated, adaptable in a fast-growing technology company environment, a strategic thinker, and detail-oriented. Successful candidates will have experience engaging with electric utilities and adjacent industries in North America.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Duties and Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Develop and manage strategic relationships with electric utilities and distributed energy resource management system (DERMS) providers in North America<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate with internal teams to support growing ChargePoint's business opportunities with utility investments in EV charging infrastructure<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Support ChargePoint's policy and sales objectives through helping to shape utility customer incentives<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Represent ChargePoint in key utility industry forums and stakeholder processes related to electric vehicles and electric vehicle charging<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Utilize SalesForce to track Utility Program details<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide Utility Program updates to internal teams on a regular cadence and at program launch<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Knowledge of the electric utility industry, including understanding of investor-owned utility, municipal utilities, and retail electricity providers structure and business model.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Existing utility contacts and experience in managing utility accounts and\u002For selling to utilities in North America<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Understanding of EV industry or related experience in clean energy, energy efficiency, or transportation. Some knowledge of utility customer programs and funding mechanisms preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in business development and\u002For client relations in the energy, transportation, technology sector or other related field.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Track record of successfully managing strategic relationships with utilities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven experience in communicating complex solutions to a specialized sector<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work independent, remote, and strong understanding of common business tools (including Microsoft Office and Salesforce)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to effectively work under tight deadlines and manage projects independently.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Resourcefulness in solving problems with limited resources.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of SalesForce reporting tools and report creation<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent people skills and an upbeat and enthusiastic attitude.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to travel frequently as needed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bachelor's degree required.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Remote  West Coast<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. <div>\n  About Us\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n   Position Summary\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n   On the ChargePoint Inside Sales team, sales cycles are born, as well as sales careers. As the first line of communication with prospects, Sales Development Representatives (SDR) have a strong understanding of the sales process, excel at researching leads, starting new relationships, and setting our North America Sales team up for success. You will use phone, email, social media, and other cutting-edge sales tools to innovatively engage with prospective buyers, identify active buying interest and create qualified sales opportunities.\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n   You'll have the chance to work on a highly competitive and collaborative team, learn from senior leadership and master your sales skills in a fast-paced environment that fosters continuous learning and professional growth. SDRs who establish high performance will have an opportunity for new challenges and career advancement within inside sales and the potential for future roles in outside sales, channel, marketing, and customer success with a hyper-growth company.\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n   What you will do\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <ul> \n  <li>Utilize Salesforce and other best in class sales tools, cold calling, live chat, and email to generate new qualified sales opportunities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Identify prospect's needs and suggest appropriate products\u002Fservices.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Build trusting relationships with prospects to qualify leads as sales opportunities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Set up meetings or calls between (prospective) customers, sales executives, and channel partners.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Report to sales manager with weekly, monthly, and quarterly results.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  What you will bring\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <ul> \n  <li>You are located in the Phoenix metropolitan area.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Previous sales experience is preferred but not required. Those interested in a career in sales should apply.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>High degree of resiliency, enabling you to bounce back from setbacks.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Player mindset: you strive to compete, grow, develop, and never back down from a challenge.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Unmatched work ethic: anything you don't know you will make up with hard work.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You are highly coachable and willing to receive and implement feedback.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Desire to grow beyond current role, regardless of function.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A passion for disrupting the traditional automotive industry by helping promote the EV industry.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimal travel is expected for this role (less than four trips per year).<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  Education\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor's degree or equivalent required.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  Location\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <ul> \n  <li>Scottsdale, Arizona<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p>ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $40,000 to $51,000. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Director, Operations Program Management<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><br> ChargePoint is seeking a motivated self-starter to join our Document Control Specialist team. As a member of our DCS team you will be a driving force in the efficient tracking and management of product configurations, engineering changes, while helping build the future of electric vehicle charging.<br> The DCS team works closely with wide array of engineering, operations, and product management teams and a direct role in the execution of ChargePoint's products. We are seeking a confident and personable individual who has exceptional organizational, analytical, and communication skills.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <b> The ideal candidate is proficient in:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Configuration management<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Change management<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Product management<\u002Fli> \n  <li>BOM creation - import\u002Fexport<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Analyzing and implementing effective processes to address business needs<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Arena PLM software and administration<\u002Fli> \n  <li>NetSuite<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As a DCS your responsibilities will include BOM creation and engineering change management and configuration management across multiple programs. You must be capable of operating in a fast-paced environment and able to deal with constant change. Duties include:<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Understanding product structures, assemblies, and supplier base and impact of change<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working with engineering, program management, and operations to understand the program schedule<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensuring responsible deliverable are completed on-time in support of the program schedule<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Driving an efficient part release \u002F documentation process<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Creating and managing the product Bill of Materials (BOM) and configurations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Creation and processing of Engineering Change Requests (ECR)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Creation and processing of Engineering Change Orders (ECO)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Creation of part numbers in Arena PLM and NetSuite<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Managing and archiving spec documents<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Expert knowledge of Arena PLM and Arena systems administration<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong knowledge of NetSuite<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 5 years of hardware NPI product management<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 5 years of configuration and change management experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent communication &amp; problem-solving skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of Siemens Team-center 11 a plus<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $70,000 to $101,000. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Director of Product Management, B2B and B2C<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Be <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>ChargePoint Station management software enables employers, retailers, property manager, parking facilities and other verticals to offer EV charging to their drivers. The Customer Onboarding, Product Manager is responsible for defining a customer-facing solution to enable order, contract, license, account management while keeping in mind the needs of customers, partners, installers and other stakeholders in delivering a superlative customer experience for new and existing ChargePoint customers. You need to will understand the business strategy, the needs of station owners, channel partners\u002Fdistributors and other partners who help enable charging and to build global solutions that help the business scale as the world electrifies every aspect of transportation. Internally, you will be collaborating with the Sales, Partner, Business Applications, and Product Management teams to help scale this rapidly growing market with small businesses to enterprise-level customers.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> In this role, you will<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Lead the definition and execution of scalable and streamlined onboarding experience for a variety of customers in collaboration with our UX team, sales, as well as customer support and other key stakeholders, including definition of key metrics for measuring quality, performance, and customer satisfaction.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prioritize requirements based on customer pain points, well-researched understanding of market needs and trends, informed by data and research inputs from our user experience team.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work closely with Engineering and Business Applications to achieve alignment on feature implementation.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure that all solutions and features are scalable are supportable for ChargePoint's business including finance, customer support, operations, legal, sales and engineering.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Qualifications &amp; Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>BS in Computer Science or equivalent technical degree required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>3-5 years of experience working with cloud software<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Direct experience in product management and in working within matrixed organizations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated commercial and technical acumen with a track record in delivering global products and understanding of local and regional differences<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience working with agile development processes, using tools such as Atlassian Jira, cloud technologies.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail with an eye towards developing scalable and supportable products<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in B2B customer onboarding or CX projects is a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in the Electric Vehicle space or software-as-a-service is a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>MBA or equivalent business experience is a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to travel to regions to understand market requirements and support our regional teams. Travel is minimal<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Passionate about ChargePoint and our mission<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Language: English<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $70,000 to $162,000. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Hardware Reliability Test Manager<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> ChargePoint is looking for an experienced and skilled <b>Staff Reliability Test Engineer<\u002Fb> to help ensure that reliability and validation testing for our EV Charging stations meet performance and reliability requirements.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Maintain updated test plan documentation (Box and Confluence) that captures complete current test status and results.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Train technicians as needed to support reliability testing, including customized product specific instructions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lead test plan execution hands-on for assigned programs, driving test schedule and resources for timely completion.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Report all test failures found daily through JIRA tickets, providing detailed cross function responses requested.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop and build new mechanical and\u002For operational stress test setups and fixtures per requirements from reliability engineer.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform data analysis as requested to effectively report on results.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Track test progress to identify test process issues, escalating as needed to minimize schedule impacts.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Document and revise test procedures as needed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform first level system FA, following through on further root cause analysis prescribed by cross functional team.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide test and\u002For equipment performance data analysis to support test-to-field correlations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Determine and setup instrumentation needed to study system performance and failure mechanisms, sourcing new instruments to enable needed measurements.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Execute prescribed experimentation and DOE's to investigate failure mechanisms.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Troubleshoot complex test setup issues to improve equipment reliability.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>10+ Years experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>BS Degree in Engineering or other related field<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> San Jose, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The targeted US
