<h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports to<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Director, Software Product Management, B2B and B2C.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Be Doing <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>ChargePoint is seeking a detail-oriented API Support Engineer to work with our strategic software partners to build applications that leverage our technology in industry changing ways. The API Support Engineer will work directly with Product Management and Engineering to drive the direction of our products in order to support these key initiatives. The API Support Engineer will be responsible for building relationships with third party developers, creating application examples using ChargePoint APIs and tools, provide technical content and expertise for white papers, product documentation, and training material, and solve difficult technical integration problems. ChargePoint has a wide variety of partners and customers in this fast-paced industry, and the API Support Engineer will work with Utilities, Fleets, Navigation Providers and other data partners. Internally, you will be collaborating with the Sales, Solutions Engineering, and Product Management teams to help support our API customers.<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Assist customers in onboarding and integrating with our API platform and serve as a liaison between customers and our engineering team.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop technical content and application examples using ChargePoint technology and third-party systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lead technical discussions with ChargePoint engineering and partner engineering staff members to enable integrations with partners and customers<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lead the maintenance of day-to-day operations of various applications and work with the engineering team to ensure technical issues are resolved on time to meet customer schedules and program commitments. Writes and performs tests for applications, fixes problems as they arise, and assists with partner launches<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Writes technical documentation and works with the technical documentation team.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assists with managing vendor relationships including scoping of application services, RFP reviews and review of deliverables<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide developer support for API integration projects in all areas of the platform<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What will you bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering is a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience of engaging with customers to onboard or manage issues<\u002Fli> \n  <li>2+ years of experience writing code as some part of your job<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficiency with common programming languages such as Java, C++, Python, Objective-C etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Solid knowledge of API standards and protocols such as SOAP, XML, REST, JSON, etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Linux command line experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Passion for solving tough problems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Travel 10-25% of your time for face-to-face meetings with partners and customers<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in the electric vehicle space is a plus<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $45,000 to $141,000. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Senior Manager of Manufacturing Test Engineering<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> ChargePoint is looking for an experienced Staff Manufacturing Test Engineer to successfully develop, productize, and scale our factory test stations.<\u002Fp> \n <p> This role will be responsible for the following activities:<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Early engagement with the Systems Design and Hardware Test Engineering teams influencing the design of factory test equipment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working with vendors to ensure equipment designs are as per specifications and monitoring tester health.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Analyzing and debugging failures, providing debug guidance to our team at the CM sites and interface with the Hardware Test Engineering team.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Implementing, and debugging new test platforms and evaluating test coverage with the broader engineering team to ensure high yields and lower cycle times on the test lines.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Driving factory test process optimizations and ensure test stations provide data that is reliable, repeatable and meets the quality expected (SPC, Cp\u002FCpk and GRR experience)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Facilities preparations, installation, validation, and training for new (NPI related) test systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Periodic monitoring of test data for statistical trends to detect component, manufacturing and measurement system changes occurring through their lifecycles<\u002Fli> \n  <li>This role requires an engineer who is self-driven, and highly motivated to gain in-depth knowledge of ChargePoint's products and test processes. He or she will be ChargePoint's first line of defense in ensuring that our testers are capable and scalable to meet the growing product volumes.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience in developing and deploying Test Equipment at scale (high volume)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of industry standards\u002Fbest practices to help test station design and factory layout.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Keen eye to home in on problems proactively by reviewing factory test data and coverage reports, gauge R&amp;Rs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Effective in building cross functional relationships to influence test coverage and station design<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with CM\u002FVendor management from prototyping, design of experiments to providing and reviewing test requirements.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in supporting a global footprint of facilities and test teams, that rely on our global Manufacturing test team to keeping the test lines up and running.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to provide 2nd level support to CM debug techs when necessary; escalate to other cross-functional teams as required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Feedback into quality and test teams to correct product defects, test station and process issues<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working knowledge of ICT, Hi-Pot and Ground Bond Testing.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiarity with ECR\u002FECO Process and special builds.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in Test Stand, Lab View or Linux\u002FPython based test software.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Bachelors or degree in Electrical\u002FMechanical\u002FSystems engineering or RF experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>5-8 years of industry experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience working in an CMs\u002FODMs\u002FOEMs<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to consolidate test requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to read circuit schematics and to debug PCBA and electro-mechanical systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experienced user of electronic test equipment such as DMMs, Power Supplies, RF test equipment and signal acquisition devices<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experienced with configuring and maintaining custom test systems (HW and SW)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Willingness to travel domestically and internationally up to 20% of the time.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $85,000 to $164,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to be part of creating an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Director of Operation<br> <br> <br> <\u002Fp>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n <p><br> ChargePoint is looking for a leader in operation leading factory capacity planning, shipment commits, forecasting, factory equipment budget, and communicate requirements and schedules to facilitate technical readiness with supply chain teams. This position will work closely with our manufacturing partners as well as our internal development and operations teams to deliver robust products that meet ChargePoint's manufacturability, cost, quality and delivery objectives. You will be managing the sustaining product portfolio and be responsible for the introduction of new products into our partners factories and sustaining them through EOL. You'll interact with specialists from other teams like Product Design, Technical Program Managers, Component Quality, Capex and others. You will communicate frequently and effectively to peers and leadership teams to keep them apprised of the status of the programs.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p> A successful candidate must have proven experience in operation management of complex supply chain and systems. What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Leading factory operations team in planning and executing development builds and new product ramps through EOL.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Drive ramp readiness with engineering, operations and factory partners<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Plan capacity and lead factory equipment budget.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Handle component readiness to ensure part availability, quality and cost.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Communicate requirements and schedules to facilitate technical readiness with supply chain teams.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Influence product manufacturability, testability, and supply chain responsiveness in pursuit of low cost and flexibility while stewarding quality<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Leading all communications, upward and downward through the organization; raising key issues and options for resolution with executive teams.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Evaluate technical capabilities of quick turn and volume PCB\u002FPCBA suppliers<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure proper implementation of engineering changes at the factory<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Drive production process improvements to achieve quality, cost and yield goals<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Bachelor\u002FMaster degree in engineering preferred, MBA are consider a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>5-8 years direct related hands-on experience and know-how with fast paced, product design and product commercialization companies. Been through 3+ product life cycles from inception to EOL<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge &amp; direct experience in NPI operations and Sustaining Operation<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Flexibility and adaptability to work in a dynamic environment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Program management experience, with excellent written and verbal English communication skills required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Able to communicate up and across (cross-functionally) succinctly and effectively<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work with limited supervision<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Up to 25% international and domestic travel may be require<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $70,000 to $154,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><br> Director, Technical Content Development and Localization<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> In this team role, you will be responsible for researching and writing technical documentation about ChargePoint charging station hardware and software for global audiences. Your ability to work cross-functionally between engineering, support, testing, and product management is essential. You will work alongside other writers, trainers, and illustrators to produce installation, site design, service, and software guides for internal and external audiences worldwide. You will maintain document revision control for output in print and online across multiple languages. Learning the products deeply will allow you to ensure consistency and clarity across all documentation.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Produce technical content to install, use and service ChargePoint products (hardware and software)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Create content that is scalable and can be easily translated into multiple languages<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Able to learn complex technical products quickly and produce technical documentation with the assistance of subject matter experts<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Partner with Technical Illustrators to create renderings and video that will be integrated into technical publications<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform all phases of technical publication content development, including planning and research, design, writing, editing, embedding illustrations, and publishing<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage content through revision control, translation, and file management<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Improve and maintain the documentation by continually reviewing, keeping up to date on released features<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Collaborate with other teams to ensure consistency and transparency across all documentation<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Minimum 4-7 years of technical writing experience in a complex product environment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must have experience documenting hardware assembly and installation at the product level, not just chip or rack level (you must know and care what a torque specification is)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with developing topic-based and structured content, understand information architecture principles and content organization, and write for a global audience by default<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Exceptional proficiency in written English<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Detail oriented with a systematic and investigative writing process that creates documentation that is accurate, concise, and follows a logical flow<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated ability to learn complex technical products quickly from subject matter experts and translate it into documentation relevant to the target audience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient in Adobe FrameMaker; knowledge of other Adobe products a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of XML\u002FDITA or HTML tools, such as oXygen or MadCap Flare<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of photography and image editing software (Photoshop, GIMP, Illustrator, etc.)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>PC proficiency in MS Office, including Outlook, Word and Excel<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work on multiple projects concurrently while meeting tight deadlines<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven organizational skills with the ability to prioritize in an environment with competing demands<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent verbal and written communication with an emphasis on teamwork skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bachelor's degree preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with CMS, LMS and\u002For TMS a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of API documentation a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of JIRA, Confluence, or similar project management tools a plus<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Manager, web Development<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> This is a full-time position working with an in-house corporate design team. You'll collaborate with talented developers and designers to deliver a cohesive, premium user experience across the ChargePoint corporate site and other marketing web properties. You'll work within existing templates and design new wireframes as our corporate needs evolve. Along the way, you'll gain valuable insight into what it takes to design compelling materials for a dynamic, rapidly evolving category.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> You have impeccable attention to the details that shape user interactions. You're a Sketch master and well versed in working through user flows, wireframing new layouts, and A\u002FB testing. You have a proven track record of collaborating with clients, developers, and other designers to deliver effective design solutions. As part of the ChargePoint web team, you will:<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Work closely with front-end developers to design strong visual patterns, delivering intuitive experiences. Your design projects will range from global site elements to multi-level content sections and interactive page modules.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Be responsible for accessible, scalable and responsive design across multiple locales and languages<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work closely with graphic designers and writers to develop and publish content<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Monitor user experience analytics to validate designs<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Help express the ChargePoint brand via UI elements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintain the website style guide, documenting evolving styles and standards<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Web\u002FGraphic Design (or related) degree or certificate<\u002Fli> \n  <li>5 years' experience as a web designer<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Online design portfolio (professional work only)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficiency in Sketch<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiarity with HTML and CSS. Strong understanding of web development for both owned and third-party websites<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiarity with Fullstory (or other experience analytics tools)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong design skills: Ideation, exploration, refinement. Able to create multiple options that meet project goals while working within established patterns and visual styles.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Great team player with strong interpersonal and communication skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Organized and detail oriented<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Preferred \n   <ul>\n    <li>Experience working as part of an in-house corporate creative team<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Experience with Adobe Creative Cloud (Illustrator, Photoshop)<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Experience with prototyping tools such as InVision<\u002Fli> \n    <li>Familiarity with MS Office (PowerPoint, Word) and file sharing platforms (Box)<\u002Fli> \n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Remote USA. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> VP of HW and Systems<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> ChargePoint is looking for a creative and versatile Director of DC Power to help ensure that our products meet high design, development and production quality. The role will play a key cross-functional role to drive many aspects including developing and production of high quality power systems.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Lead a team of engineers in development of high power AC to DC and DC to DC converters.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist in architect and design of high power dc systems for fast EV chargers.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Mentor team members as they navigate their technical and career growth paths.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Responsible for all aspect of product design, including modelling, key component selection, schematic capture, PCB layout, code development, magnetics design, thermal design, regulatory and compliance considerations, DFM.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Design and develop advanced soft switching 40-100 kW, up to 1500 VDC multi-level converters.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Design and develop multi-level 100-200 kW, up to 1500 VDC four quadrant grid tie inverters.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiar with power topologies such at LLC, phase shifted full bridge, flyback, forward, multi-level converters including PFC (single phase and three phase) and associated techniques such as ZVS\u002FZCS.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work effectively with cross-functional teams to resolve early (architectural) and late (lab, test &amp; validation).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure high reliability of the product under stress conditions and environments for extended periods.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Implement and enforce processes\u002F design guidelines and practices that enables the DC power team to scale in size without sacrificing efficiency or quality.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>B.S. required (M.S. desired) in Engineering (electrical, computer or electronics).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>10+ years of experience in leading teams to bring power electronics products to market.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong electrical\u002Felectronic design skills and understanding of system level engineering tradeoffs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven track record in managing and growing talented global teams<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience designing AC\u002FDC DC\u002FDC power conversion systems.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Able to drive solutions across software, mechanical, power and thermal boundaries to assure great results.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience working with x-functional teams: mechanical, software, and test.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Current knowledge of industry standards for consumer and industrial products.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of EV charging standards a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Some travel is expected.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $147,000 to $280,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.<\u002Fp> \n <p> If there is a match between your experiences\u002Fskills and the Company needs, we will contact you directly.<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer.<br> Applicants only - Recruiting agencies do not contact.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Software Engineering Manager<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing <\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n <p>Millions of drivers will be switching to electric vehicles over the coming years. We need your help to make their experience easy. You will design and build back-end systems that power our mobile app, provide special benefits to drivers, and more. You will work with a collaborative, cross-functional team that takes ideas from the drawing board to full-scale implementation. Your outstanding work will speed up the transition to electrified transportation worldwide!<\u002Fp> \n <p> As a member of Cloud Payments team, you will help make different modes of payment methods (Card Present and Card Not Present) available to our drivers, which is a critical part of our overall driver experience.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>You can architect flexible and scalable systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You can lead a project from conception to post-release monitoring and maintenance<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You will work closely with Product Management, Design and QA team to understand user requirements, discuss trade-offs and plan timelines<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You can make thoughtful and respectful contributions to code reviews and design discussions<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You are excited to dive into code you've never seen before to figure out what it does and how to make it better<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You can mentor junior developers and make your team stronger<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You have a respectful, positive, and constructive attitude<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>You have 8+ years of experience building back-end software<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You have an understanding of modern software architecture components (e.g. Distributed Systems, Containerization, Micro Services etc.)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You have experience with Java server-side programming language (if knowledge in PHP also, it is a plus). Framework knowledge such as Spring, Code igniter is a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You have a strong understanding of relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc.)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You know how to apply computer science algorithms and data structures<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You have built and used RESTful APIs<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You are well versed with modern SDLC concepts<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You communicate effectively with cross-functional groups<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $85,000 to $196,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. <p><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to be part of creating an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market. Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Director - Test Development Engineering<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint's Hardware Test Engineering team is seeking a Senior Test Development Engineer to support the development of state-of-the-art automated production test systems. The ideal candidate enjoys self-directed problem solving, as well as having experience in electrical, mechanical, and test software to be able to take ownership of new development projects from start to finish.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li><p>Architect and develop fully integrated test systems using Linux in a scalable production environment<\u002Fp> internal frameworks<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Debug and optimize automation to reduce cycle time, improve yield and uptime<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Participate in product design reviews, code reviews, and test coverage reviews<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Analyze parametric and functional test results from manufacturing facilities<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Drive towards better-integrated test solutions and code reuse<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Travel internationally to manufacturing facilities to support NPI and test HW updates (5%)<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li><p>Bachelor's Degree in engineering (or advanced degree) with a minimum of 3 years of experience required<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Proficient with process integration of electromechanical systems<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Ability to the end-to-end design of PCBA, sub-assembly, and system-level test systems<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Experience in Python, and other programming languages, and familiar with UNIX<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Experience with statistical analysis tools and modern database interfaces<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Familiar with communication protocols such as CAN, UART, Ethernet, SPI, I2C, etc.<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Bonus and\u002For other programming languages<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Demonstrated ability and willingness to make critical system-level design decisions and drive projects from start to finish with <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p> The Interconnect Design team is looking for a skilled <b>Engineering Technician.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <div>\n   Senior Manager, Interconnect Design\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> The ideal candidate is expected to:<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Accept and complete work assignments on schedule with a high quality outcome.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Interact with engineers and ICD team on cable harness builds.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Good communication and engagement are essential.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrate general technical knowledge in cable harness manufacturing and associated processes.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Able to utilize basic manufacturing tools to assemble cable harnesses.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work with a diverse team and take constructive feedback.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Has a proactive attitude with initiative and the ability to take direction and work independently<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Adhere to established standards, be diligent in detail, and balance quality of work and efficiency.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to be flexible and learn quickly in a dynamic environment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work around high power and high current systems. Must understand and adhere to basic safety requirements for projects.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Identify issues, escalate them to the appropriate channels, and implement solutions.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Minimum of 2 years related to Cable and Harness manufacturing experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Basic understanding of cable and harness manufacturing process and standards<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Preferred<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Knowledge of advanced manufacturing processes and materials<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prototype and production experience in a high-volume cable and harness shop<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to read, and understand complex electrical harness wire drawings and schematics<\u002Fli> \n  <li>IPC620 or similar certification<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $50,000 to $100,000. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Director, NA Channel Sales<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> ChargePoint is seeking an experienced Senior Partner Account Manager with a proven track record of leading and managing a mature channel ecosystem. This full-time position requires close collaboration with ChargePoint leadership, field sales, inside sales, finance, support, marketing, and sales operations to drive channel revenue in the Southeast region. The Senior Partner Account Manager will establish influential partner relationships with distributors, resellers, and strategic partners, build quarterly and ad-hoc business plans and act as the partners' advocate within ChargePoint.<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Manage and influence distribution and value-added reseller channel partnerships within the Southeast territory<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Collaborate with Chargepoint sales and marketing leadership team to develop strategic and tactical plans to increase channel revenue in defined territory<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Recruit, onboard and support channel partners in defined territory<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage &amp; develop executive level relationships with customers and partners<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Create growth-oriented sales plans for new and existing channel partners<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Educate partners and their customers on EV market and charging solutions<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide ongoing reporting &amp; transparency<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Partner with Director of channel sales and regional directors to shape the strategic priorities and influence leadership of to drive their vision, engage their teams, and shape the culture.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to travel as much as 50% of the time<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Territories that you will be covering:<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b> Southeast<\u002Fb> <b>Territory: <\u002Fb>Delaware, Maryland, Virginia, West Virginia, North Carolina, South Carolina, Georgia, Florida, Alabama, Mississippi, Kentucky, Tennessee<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> South Central Territory: <\u002Fb>Missouri, Kansas, Oklahoma, Arkansas, Texas, Louisiana<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Electric vehicle or renewable energy experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Understanding of grant, incentive, and federal procurement process<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Impactful presentation skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Has industry expertise &amp; loves to close the gap between industry &amp; technology<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Positive attitude, excited to take on new challenges everyday<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Understanding of construction bid process<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Sees learning as a never-ending process<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Start-up and get things done mentality<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Skilled multitasker, comfortable with hyper growth challenges<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with CRM tool Salesforce, Microsoft Suite, Tableau<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>8+ years' experience in channel management, distribution or channel sales<\u002Fli> \n  <li>3+ years' experience managing direct reports<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven track record developing and negotiating strategic partnerships, contracts, and alliances<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience influencing senior stakeholders across organizational lines and borders<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Master of channel process and operational excellence<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Contract initiation, negotiation, &amp; execution<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to balance partner management, sales, and business development skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Autonomous, team-player, self-motivated, and influential<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience building and leading diverse teams<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Software\u002FSaaS\u002Fhardware sales experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Growth oriented business acumen<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>US Remote<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p>ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $58,000 to $121,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Director of Product Management<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> As Product Manager for Fleet Home and Mobility Solutions you will be responsible for building a suite of products enabling fleets and employers to manage fleet and company car drivers charging at home, on-route, and at work. This multi-faceted product experience will span a consumer facing mobile app, enterprise software and enabling new business processes via APIs. You will navigate the complex relationships between, leasing companies, fuel cards, telematics providers, corporate fleet managers, and drivers to build solutions that help the business scale as the world electrifies every aspect of transportation. Internally, your customers will be the other members of the Product Management team and Sales team who require new capabilities to meet the needs of this rapidly evolving market and enterprise level customers.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> In this role, you will<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Set and execute the product strategy based on market and end-customer requirements as well as customer support and other key stakeholders, including definition of key metrics for measuring quality, performance, and customer engagement<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prioritize requirements based on well-researched understanding of market needs and trends, informed by data and research inputs from our user experience team<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work closely with Engineering and Business Applications to achieve alignment on feature implementation<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure that all solutions meet or exceed global privacy and security requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure that all solutions and features are scalable and supportable for ChargePoint's business including finance, customer support, operations, legal, sales and engineering<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work closely with lighthouse customers to drive innovation into our software to meet and exceed market needs<\u002Fli> \n  <li>The role is remote, but will require close collaboration with customers and stakeholders in European and Pacific time-zones<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Qualifications &amp; Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Direct experience in product management with a track record of successfully delivering complex projects in cross-functional environments<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated commercial and technical acumen with a track record in delivering global products and understanding of local and regional differences<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experienced at understanding market and customer requirements and translating that to complex technical requirements for software engineering teams<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail with an eye towards developing scalable and supportable products<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience working with agile development processes, using tools such as Atlassian Jira, cloud technologies is a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with fleets, e-mobilty, or software-as-a-service is a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>MBA or equivalent business experience is a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>BS in Computer Science or equivalent technical degree is a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to travel to regions to understand market requirements and support our regional teams. Travel is minimal<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Passionate about ChargePoint and our mission<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Language: English; multi-lingual is a plus<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> US, Remote<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $65,000 to $147,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Director Sales Engineering<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> In this role, you will be responsible for supporting the regional sales team with technical aspects of customer engagement. You will be responsible for actively driving and managing technology evaluation, working as a key advisor and advocate for our products and solutions, engaging with customers in person or on the phone, performing engineering site assessments, and developing recommendations to assist customers with deployment of electric vehicle charging infrastructure. You will also be responsible for developing RFP responses.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The applicant must be self-motivated and able to effectively manage their time.<br> Travel requirement: Approximately 30% travel within United States.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Develop and deliver presentations to partners and customers in support of the sales process, educating potential customers on the benefits of ChargePoint solutions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You act as a technical consultant, learning and understanding customer needs and developing the right solutions; working with product management to help align product development with customer and market needs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide technical training on our products and solutions to ChargePoint sales, partners, as well as end customers.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintain knowledge of the competitive landscape and how to sell against the competition.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Identify technical issues that may affect customer satisfaction and proactively work to resolve such issues.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You provide both general \"best practice\" and site-specific engineering recommendations for civil and electrical infrastructure and telecommunications (cellular and WiFi); analyze and perform detailed calculations for electrical service load profiling, capacity planning, and energy management.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintain knowledge of the National Electrical Code (NEC) and relevant state and local codes, specifically related to Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment (EVSE).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You respond to functional and technical elements of RFPs; assist in the development and execution of SoWs (statements of work) and other proposals.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Respond to Information Security \u002F Information Technology (IS\u002FIT) questions related to network security and data privacy.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>BS or MS in Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, or equivalent experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 8+ years of combined experience in technical sales or technical consulting<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent presentation, oral and written communication skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong customer facing and relationship building skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience around some of electrical engineering, construction management, telecommunications, information technology, technical writing.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>US Remote<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p>ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $52,000 to $137,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Director - Test Engineering Development<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is seeking a Staff Test Engineer to join our growing Test Engineering team. Our test systems are deployed to our manufacturing locations and interact with our products' software, electrical and mechanical components during the manufacturing process. The Staff Test Engineer will be responsible for creating a common architecture and processes for High-Power EV Charger Systems and overseeing consistent implementation across product lines and factory locations.<\u002Fp> \n <p> This role is critical to the successful design, integration, and deployment of automated functional testers to ensure all our electromechanical sub-assemblies and systems are manufactured, programmed, configured, and assembled according to specifications. You will be involved with test infrastructure throughout their entire lifecycle and by cultivating strong cross-functional relationships with a diverse group of Hardware, Software, and Operations teams. You will also support test design engineers and mentor junior engineers on the team to help them achieve their full potential at ChargePoint.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li><p>Collaborate on advanced hardware projects through the entire product test development lifecycle<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Cross-functional definition of test requirements for high-volume manufacturing processes<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Participate in product design reviews, code reviews, and test coverage reviews<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Establish and maintain guidelines for documentation of requirements and test plans<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Help define and measure KPIs for quality to drive actionable improvements<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Mentor and inspire junior engineers<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Travel internationally to manufacturing facilities to support NPI and test HW updates (5%)<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li><p>BS or MS in engineering with 8+ years of experience with an emphasis on high-power electronics, infrastructure, and technical leadership<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Strong fundamentals in Analog\u002FPower electronics and High power distribution design<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Hands-on experience with power electronics hardware development and testing<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Experience with equipment for Power Characterization and Test<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Collaborative approach to project management and organizational skills<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Proficient in Python and\u002For other programming languages, familiar with UNIX<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Bonus Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li><p>Experience with PCB-level manufacturing test methodologies (ICT, FCT, AOI, etc.)<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Mechatronics and\u002For Systems Integration background<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Experience with motor controllers, grid-connected inverters, chargers, power conversion topologies<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Prior PLC, Test Automation, and Integration experience<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n  <li><p>Experience with mechanical systems<\u002Fp> <\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $85,000 to $164,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. <p><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Software Engineering Manager<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Millions of drivers will be switching to electric vehicles over the coming years. We need your help to make their experience easy.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You will design and build back-end systems that power our popular mobile appthe primary way drivers find chargers and interact with our network.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You will work with a collaborative, cross-functional team that takes ideas from the drawing board to full-scale implementation.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Your outstanding work will speed up the transition to electrified transportation worldwide!<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>You architect flexible and scalable system sand APIs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You can lead a project from conception to post-release monitoring and maintenance.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You make thoughtful and respectful contributions to code reviews and design discussions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You are excited to dive into code you've never seen before, figure out what it does, make it better, and document it.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You define user requirements, discuss trade-offs, and plan timelines.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You mentor junior developers and make your team stronger.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You test your code to ensure correctness and minimize regressions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You have a respectful, positive, and constructive attitude.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>You have six or more years of experience building back-end software.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You have experience with at least one server-side programming language (PHP, Java, Go, Python, etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>You have <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Senior Manager, Mechanical Design Engineering<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> The Mechanical Design group is seeking a hands on Staff Mechanical Engineer to join our team. As a member of the MD team you will be a driving force of innovation and helping build the future of electric vehicle charging.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The Staff Mechanical Engineer will play a direct role in the design and execution of ChargePoint's products. We are seeking a confident and personable engineer who has exceptional manufacturing experience, including design for manufacturing, design for cost and assembly, production tooling development with a proven track record of delivering world-class products in cross-functional teams.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> As a Staff Mechanical Engineer, your responsibilities will focus on the manufacturability, cost effectiveness, and design for quality of current production and new products:<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Interfacing directly with Asia suppliers to efficiently execute designs into mass production<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Identifying design opportunities for quality, cost, assembly, and manufacturing<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Production tooling development and monitoring into production.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Root cause and failure analysis on current products<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 10 years of industry experience in a Mechanical Engineering role<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Multiple examples of leading projects into production.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong working knowledge of injection molding, CNC machining, sheet metal, aluminum die casting and extrusion, cosmetic part finishing, busbars, custom magnetics and capacitors, and mass production processes<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A self-starter who is comfortable driving multiple parts and aspects of the product design process simultaneously.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to learn quickly and operate outside of your comfort zone<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient in CAD (NX highly preferred, others accepted)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to review and optimize 2D drawings, including understanding tolerances of various manufacturing methods and GD&amp;T.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Desired Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> The ideal candidate would also have design experience in the following areas:<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>High power system and interconnect design (up to 1kV &amp; up to 500A)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ruggedized outdoor electro-mechanical products (IP protection)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Cooling system and thermal solution design (both air and liquid)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Material selection for functional and regulatory requirements<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $85,000 to $162,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.<\u002Fp> \n <p> If there is a match between your experiences\u002Fskills and the Company needs, we will contact you directly.<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer.<br> Applicants only - Recruiting agencies do not contact.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to be part of creating an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <b> Reports To<\u002Fb>\n  <br> Director, Strategic Sourcing\n  <br> \n  <b>What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb>\n  <br> The Global Supply Manager (GSM) is the end-to-end owner of sourcing strategy and execution, acting as the business representative of ChargePoint to external supply partners and as a key commercial authority on internal cross-functional teams. Applying a deep understanding of manufacturing processes and supplier behavior, the GSM is responsible for aligning internal and external stakeholders to anticipate supply risks, drive mitigations, and deliver optimum value to ChargePoint. This role is a high-growth opportunity to shape not only ChargePoint's future product realization but also how the company makes decisions and delivers on its ambitions.\n  <br> \n  <b>What You Will Be Bring<\u002Fb>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <ul>\n  <li>Strong understanding of strategic sourcing toolkit, including product life-cycle, negotiation, contracts, and cross-functional coordination<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Nose for identifying and capturing cost savings opportunities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to triage multiple inbound requests and drive issues to closure<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Passion for crafting data-driven recommendations and building coalitions to put into action<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent communication and situational awareness<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Creative, proactive problem-solving<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Eye for process improvement and comfort working without a script<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Professionalism and integrity<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n  <b>Requirements<\u002Fb>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <ul>\n  <li>12+ years supply chain experience, including 7+ years directly responsible for supplier performance during NPI<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong knowledge of supply chain management tools and best practices<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bachelor's degree or higher in Finance, Supply Chain, Engineering, or related<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience sourcing custom mechanical or power electronics strongly preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with capital equipment NPI a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Willingness to travel ~20% globally<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $85,000 to $151,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h1 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Position Summary<\u002Fb><\u002Fh1> \n <p> In this critical Inside Sales Representative (ISR) role, you will have a successful track record and relevant experience selling hardware\u002Fsoftware solutions to various customers. You must have experience identifying sales opportunities, pipeline management, forecasting, and working opportunities to closure. Additionally, you will work closely with VAR\u002FChannel Partners while developing relationships with prospects and stakeholders. You must be able to thrive in a fast-paced sales environment, be creative, independent, focused, solution-oriented, and an excellent problem solver.<\u002Fp> \n <p> You will have the chance to work on a highly competitive and collaborative team, learn from senior leadership and master your sales skills in a fast-paced environment that fosters continuous learning and professional growth. ISRs who establish high performance will have an opportunity for new challenges and career advancement within inside sales and the potential for future roles in outside sales, channel, marketing, and customer success with a hyper-growth company.<\u002Fp> \n <h1 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What you will do<\u002Fb><\u002Fh1> \n <ul>\n  <li>Qualify and develop new business opportunities from accurate daily, weekly, and monthly reports related to activity tracking, opportunity, and pipeline management.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work closely and build relationships with internal and external customers, and channel partners to ensure opportunities advance through the sales process to closure.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Leverage your deep understanding of the ChargePoint sales process and
