<p><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Experience in designing and implementing new Salesforce objects, workflow rules, custom layouts, and other standard Salesforce customization<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Hands on experience of CPQ functionality including Product setup, Product Options, Product configuration &amp; rules, Pricing, Discounting and Quote templates in Steelbrick CPQ<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong experience on Apex development, SOQL queries, data migration (Apex data loader), triggers, custom settings, validation rules, and Process Builder<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Thorough understanding of Salesforce Deployment Process and tools like ANT, Change Sets and Force.com IDE<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Build integrations between Salesforce and external applications using REST, SOAP APIs, oAuth and Single Sign-On.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience deploying code changes from development to test to production environment(s)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of Product Development Lifecycle and DevOps Tools like JIRA.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Good understanding on CPQ renewals business process that includes renewal contract, Amendment, Co-termination of multiple contracts<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong experience working with Orders, contracts, subscriptions, Assets and other standard\u002FCPQ objects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A strong analytical approach to business process design with an emphasis on cross-functional inter-dependencies. Ability to analyze\u002Fidentify gaps in functional\u002Fbusiness requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participate and collaborate in requirement analysis, Quality Assurance (QA), User Acceptance Testing (UAT), and deployments, as well as sprint planning<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work collaboratively in a creative, Agile environment and manage agile task assignments<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in Service cloud is a plus<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor's Degree or higher in Computer Science or related field or equivalent work experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum of 5 years of experience in development and implementation of Salesforce.com<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong Salesforce customization and configuration experience with at least 1 or more of the following Salesforce modules: Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Communities and Billings<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 2 Years of Experience working with CPQ<\u002Fli> \n  <li>3+ years of experience developing business applications using Agile methodology<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Significant participation in or leadership of at least one full implementation of Salesforce<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with technical delivery - build, system testing handover\u002Fcoordination; technical documentation and deployment activities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience converting functional requirements to technical requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Estimate user stories, plan team capacity and work closely with Scrum Master to finalize Sprint scope<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Certifications Required: Salesforce Administrator<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Preferred<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Certifications desired: Salesforce Advanced Administrator, Salesforce Sales Cloud or Salesforce Service Cloud.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of Quote to Cash process<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with Sales Cloud, Partner Community, Salesforce CPQ, Subscription Billings and Order Management<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with Service Cloud is a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with ETL tools like MuleSoft or Informatica Cloud would be a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with NetSuite ERP will be a plus<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Scottsdale, AZ<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $65,000 to $133,000. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Director, Product Portfolio Management based in North America<\u002Fp> \n <p> Matrix reporting with Senior Director, Solutions Portfolio &amp; Global Open Network based in EU.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Overview<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Are you a highly analytical, strategic thinker? Do you enjoy dissecting business models and daydream about ways to increase adoption? Do you want to do that at a mission-driven company that is transforming transportation by enabling everyone to drive electric?<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint's Product Portfolio team provides strategic direction and defines solutions to serve our commercial and fleet customers as well as our EV Driver users. Our portfolio of solutions addresses the needs of various segments through a combination of hardware, software, support, and purchase models that match our customers' goals.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As the Senior Product Portfolio Manager, Driver and Mobility Services you will lead the strategy to maximize ChargePoint's solution value for all drivers and mobility services across ChargePoint verticals. The goal of this role is to deepen the ChargePoint team's understanding of the unique customer needs across the driver and mobility services and to craft and implement strategies to increase charging adoption. The successful candidate will be analytical and structured in sharing their thinking with others as well as highly energetic and collaborative, thriving off exploring new ideas and iterating on them with input from a wide array of stakeholders to drive alignment and consensus.<\u002Fp> \n <p> In this role, you will:<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Become an expert on the needs of assigned customer verticals including understanding key use cases and mapping customer journeys<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work cross-functionally within ChargePoint and with external partners to craft customer-centric vision, strategy, and business plan<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Estimate market size and bring quantitative and qualitative analysis to prioritize focus areas<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Analyze ChargePoint's business model, GTM and offer structure to serve the segment; recommending how to optimize for rapid adoption, high customer satisfaction and retention.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Track market trends and competitive offerings<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Build relationships with customers, partners, and other industry stakeholders to drive product direction and ensure capabilities meet market needs and customer goals<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Utilize expertise of business strategy, financial modeling, business data analysis, and customer discovery to define the solution vision and inform product planning and development<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop partnerships across the ecosystem where needed to support ChargePoint's solution portfolio<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Support the sales and marketing teams to position solutions for particular customer verticals<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>A minimum of 8 years of experience in product management, consulting, business development or corporate strategy roles<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong Excel, Tableau, and other data analysis and financial modeling skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent ability to synthesize data and represent it clearly and simply for executives, customers and other stakeholders to drive decision making<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with identifying partnership opportunities, creating relationships and negotiating partnership agreements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with customer discovery, customer journey mapping and market requirements gathering<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with market sizing and estimating the TAM of segments and solutions<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Intellectual curiosity, energy and enthusiasm for the customer and business problems to solve<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to navigate ambiguity, work independently and chart direction of projects\u002Fprograms<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to manage multiple and diverse stakeholders across businesses and leadership levels<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong organizational skills, ability to execute in a fast-paced, high-demand environment while balancing multiple priorities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent cross- functional team player.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>B.S., experience in financial, economic or energy modelling and\u002For MBA or equivalent is preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Passion for emerging markets, the EV space, and associated trends<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bonus: Strong understanding and experience in eMSP business models for EV charging<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Campbell, CA or Munich, DE or Remote with high involvement with team members in US Pacific, Eastern and European time zones<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $85,000 to $176,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Summary<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> The user experience (UX) researcher creates understanding and empathy around user needs, stated and unstated, for the entire product team including designers, product managers, and engineers. The user experience position at ChargePoint is critical because we base our product decisions on what is best for the end user and create experiences that define our industry. As electric vehicle charging pioneer and industry leader, we constantly strive to understand how our user needs and expectations are emerging and evolving. The UX researcher will provide insight into these new behaviors and shape our product definitions by delivering compelling, written, in-person and visual presentations on research findings. User experience (UX) is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people rely on. We strive to learn and understand our users' needs, behaviors, and emotions to yield insights that inform product strategy and guide the design of the experiences we create. Our multidisciplinary UX teams include designers, researchers, product managers, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and performance. We collaborate closely with product managers, software engineers, and many others to solve complex challenges and craft powerful experiences that highlight our products' unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches most electric vehicle drivers while exemplifying a key principle that is core to ChargePoint's philosophy: \"Focus on the user and all else will follow.\"<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Conduct independent research on multiple aspects of product and service experiences with consumer and enterprise users<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Collect and analyze user behavior through usability studies, structured interviews, field visits, ethnography, surveys, benchmark studies, server logs and online experiments (A\u002FB testing)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with Designers, Product Managers, Engineers, and others to prioritize research opportunities in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Understand and incorporate complex technical and business requirements into research<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Define actionable insights for both short term and long-term product development<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Advocate research findings to diverse audiences through written reports, in-person presentations and workshops<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Engage insight disciplines (Customer Support, Marketing, Analytics) across the company to maintain and share a holistic view of the customer<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Contribute to our research processes, tools and methods<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>BA\u002FBS degree in Anthropology, Human Factors, Psychology, HCI\u002FComputer Science, Journalism, or other related fields or equivalent practical experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>5 years of experience translating user research into product designs and practices<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A portfolio demonstrating past work experience and deliverables (e.g., study plans, reports, personas)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong understanding of the strengths and shortcomings of different research methods, including when and how to apply them during the product development process<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Able to effectively collaborate with key stakeholders from business, marketing and engineering teams<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Able to strike a balance between tactical problem-solving goals and strategic, long-term solutions<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Detailed knowledge and understanding of evaluative, generative, quantitative and secondary research methods, and expertise in at least one research methodology<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with all aspects of design research planning, execution, and advocacy<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience delivering projects in a variety of industries, services, or form factors: Consumer, B2B\u002FEnterprise\u002FSaaS, hardware, mobile and\u002For desktop applications<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience and\u002For interest in the energy, service, construction, or transportation industries<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><br> <b>Preferred qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Master's degree or PhD in a related <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to be part of creating an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Sr. Director, Corporate, Securities and M&amp;A<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is seeking an experienced and self-motivated Paralegal to join its legal team. In this role, you will support the legal organization by supporting the legal team as a whole with processing documents for signature using docusign, maintaining the corporate subsidiary records, assisting with corporate filings and much more. In addition to Legal, you will work with nearly every team at ChargePoint, including IT, Information Security, Sales, Marketing, Operations, Engineering, and Product. This is the right role for you if you are someone who is solutions-oriented, collaborative, and able to think quickly, communicate clearly, and come up with streamlined solutions to process challenges.<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Duties include general corporate housekeeping matters, including: \n   <ul>\n    <li>Drafting and maintaining corporate minutes, resolutions, and corporate approvals as needed;<\u002Fli> \n    <li>entity formation; entity dissolution; entity foreign qualifications and DBAs, and obtaining EINS, especially with non-US based entities;<\u002Fli> \n    <li>assist with contract and document management;<\u002Fli> \n    <li>assist with corporate transactions and digital signatures;<\u002Fli> \n    <li>maintain corporate entity structure and records;<\u002Fli> \n    <li>working with local corporate counsel as necessary to support filings and compliance with local laws; and<\u002Fli> \n    <li>experience and knowledge of SEC filings such as Form 3 and Form 4 filings.<\u002Fli> \n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Process requests for certificate of insurance with our broker<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Support M&amp;A\u002Fgeneral corporate activities (e.g., due diligence, corporate filings)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist the Legal Operations lead with contractual record management and lead the team on corporate record keeping and management<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Communicate with internal stakeholders by providing excellent customer service to colleagues at all levels in the U.S. and Europe by responding to inquiries in a timely, professional and courteous manner<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Collaborate with cross functional teams including finance, tax, stock admin, accounting, people operations and compliance to manage initiatives<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist and support the legal group as a whole in administrative tasks, including the General Counsel, including monitoring and maintaining the internal legal alias<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage corporate legal intranet site<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepare reports and metrics for the legal team, as needed<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Support ad-hoc and special projects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Help to develop, implement and continually improve processes and procedures<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor's degree and 8+ years of experience. 3-5 years of corporate transactional work at a law firm<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong initiative and problem-solving skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Have a current California Notary License<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient in MS Word, Excel, Box, Google Docs, PowerPoint and collaboration software (such as Docusign)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Detail oriented with a strong desire to create structure and scalable processes<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Customer-centric and solutions-oriented approach in supporting both external and internal clients while protecting the best interest of the company<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in a global business environment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong oral and written communication skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to maintain strict confidentiality of sensitive information<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Research and analytical skills are a differentiating plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong interpersonal skills and effective communication and presentation styles<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong work ethic with ability to work independently<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Campbell, CA or local to HQ<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Director, Project Implementation &amp; Asset Operation<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> ChargePoint is looking for an experienced professional to build and lead a team to support our development of the National Electric Vehicle Infrastructure grants. You and your team will be responsible for organizing requests, executing audits via contracted partners, evaluating technical EV site audit documents, and validating bids and budgets. In this role you will work closely with our Strategic Sales, Grants, Design-Build, and other groups to support winning grant proposals.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Manage the funnel of potential\u002Fcandidate Sites.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work cross-functionally to vet and onboard new site audit providers as necessary.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop tools and processes for managing a high volume of requests and audits.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Track contractors' progress and deliverables related to audit work, and report often to stakeholders and leadership.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review and evaluate drone footage, photos, pre-designs, and other data to validate site and project viability.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Evaluate early site designs and Rough Order Magnitude (ROM) estimates for construction.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist with developing project construction budgets based on ROM estimates.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with Sales, Grants, and Design-Build teams to iterate the scope and deliverables of our site audit program to meet the needs of the program as requirements change or vary between states.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven ability to build and manage a team and implement new cross-functional processes.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>2+ years of EV Infrastructure or similar industry experience.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>3+ years of electrical and civil site evaluation and\u002For estimating experience.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>3+ years of drafting or using electrical and construction plan sets.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>2+ years in drone, satellite, GPRS, or GIS-related evaluation work.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>2+ years of management experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiarity with Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) regulations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience working extensively cross-functionally.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient in multiple Business Applications.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Positive, execution-oriented bias for action.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Willingness to travel ~20%.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Hardware Reliability Test Manager<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> ChargePoint is looking for a creative and versatile <b>Reliability Test Technician<\u002Fb> to help ensure that our EV Charging stations meet all internal and external performance and reliability requirements.<\u002Fp> \n <p> This Test Technician will participate in establishing ChargePoint's quality and reliability requirements, carry out all types of standard testing, design and implement new test methods and equipment.<\u002Fp> \n <p> To succeed, the technician must have both strong hands-on skills, and be able to thrive in a rapidly evolving company and marketplace.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Implement reliability and validation test plans for all aspects, (Mechanical, Electrical and cosmetic) of our EV chargers and subsystems during development phases: functional, life cycle, thermal, environmental, stress, and transportation\u002Fpackaging<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Establish appropriate ongoing reliability test criteria, methods, and equipment for sustaining products, and evaluate test results<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review partner and supplier test results and run additional testing, if required on components, systems, and packaging<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Help define test facility and equipment requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Build simple to moderately complex test fixtures<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Establish internal test standards and methods for all aspects of EV chargers: cables, enclosures, labels and finishes, PCBAs, etc.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Minimum 5 years' experience in product validation, environmental and reliability testing<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A wide range of experience designing and implementing tests for mechanical and electronic products<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience testing 240-480VAC and 500-1000VDC products strongly preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Current knowledge of industry standards for consumer and industrial products<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of EV charging standards a plus<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Please choose San Jose, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $50,000 to $95,750. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.<\u002Fp> \n <p> If there is a match between your experiences\u002Fskills and the Company needs, we will contact you directly.<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer.<br> Applicants only - Recruiting agencies do not contact.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Senior Manager, Customer Delivery, Product Operations<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Become part of the excitement, join the Charge Point team as we build the future. As Program Manager, Customer Delivery, you will have a core role in our product delivery and roll-out to new and existing customer. This role is both externally facing working directly with some of our most important customers as well as internally facing working closely together with Product and Engineering to deliver what we have sold.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> In this role, you will:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Create the structures and framework that will set us up for successful customer delivery of new products  from contract phase to final delivery<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Be the feedback loop from customers and sales to our product teams to support prioritization and focus on the right topics and make sure expectations are always aligned across the board<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work closely together with Sales and Partnership managers to management and align customer expectations to new and ongoing product deliverables<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Make sure our functional teams; marketing, sales, support and operations are involved timely ready with the information and processes required to support new products<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work closely with stakeholders at all levels to get buy-in, align and understand needs and requirements and sell the program internally<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Report and escalate risks and customer health status to relevant parties and follow up to ensure that these are being tackled in a timely manner based on criticality<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work in the Atlassian ecosystem to structure and present and maintain information and data in an easily digestible format<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Engineering, Interdisciplinary studies, or similar<\u002Fli> \n  <li>5-10 years demonstrated program and project management having successfully delivered multiple, complex projects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with go-to-market strategy and organizational enablement<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with customer relationship management during complex project deliveries<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with running projects in Jira and collaborating with Product and Engineering from a program management perspective<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to remain flexible and thrive in an ambiguous and dynamic environment<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $85,000 to $151,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Senior Director, Product Management, Products and Platforms<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> ChargePoint is seeking an experienced and process-oriented Senior Product Manager to join our Products and Platforms Product Management team. The <b>Senior Product Manager, Sustaining<\u002Fb> role is a hands-on role which will include work on existing products including creating better ways to install our products. The role of this individual includes:<\u002Fp> \n <p> +Supporting shipping products, including prioritization of field issues, field upgrades, feature requests, and running changes.<\u002Fp> \n <p> +Intake, disposition and prioritize sustaining Product feature requests.<\u002Fp> \n <p> +Support Product Product Management related Product Life Cycle Activities including End Of Life \u002F End of Support programs, Early Bid enablement, Sales Training, Beta Release Plans, and GA of the products.<\u002Fp> \n <p> +Work with Solutions Engineering to document answers to technical questions and support the evolution of knowledge base sharing.<\u002Fp> \n <p> +Support Operations in planning product transitions.<\u002Fp> \n <p> +Work with Operations and Maintenance on better ways to Install our products.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> +Five or more years of hands-on Product Management experience (or equivalent) on hardware products.<\u002Fp> \n <p> +Experience working with Product Managers, Engineering, Operations, Sales and Sales Operations.<\u002Fp> \n <p> +Crystal clear written and verbal communications skills.<\u002Fp> \n <p> +Strong self-starting initiative with a sense of urgency.<\u002Fp> \n <p> +Passionate about ChairgePoint and our mission.<\u002Fp> \n <p> +Bachelor of Science (B.S.) degree.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $85,000 to $188,000. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to be part of creating an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Manager, Failure Analysis<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Position Summary<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is looking for an experienced Failure Analysis Specialist to own all aspects of failure analysis. This person must be passionate about the EV space and ensuring that our products and services meet the expectations of our customers. This specialist must be adept at both hands on technical problem solving and at leading quality efforts across functions. He or she must be able to effectively and comfortably communicate at all levels within ChargePoint and our suppliers, both verbally and in writing, and through presentations. To be successful at ChargePoint this person must be highly motivated, self-directed, and comfortable working in a loosely structured and fast-paced environment.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Own Failure Analysis from a cradle to grave perspective<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Be an excellent team player and have good familiarity with sharing data and strategy<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide detailed weekly reports to Product Quality and Engineering teams<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work closely with engineering techs and help direct their activities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Help drive RCA actions on weekly PQE meetings<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with our CM partners to track field failures and help develop systems to improve data collection processes<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with HV test equipment as well as write TRD for automating equipment<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Qualifications and Desired Skills:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>B.S. Electrical Engineering (Or Equivalent Knowledge)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Troubleshooting electronics board level and system level<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reading log files to extract insight to drive forward RCA<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum five years' experience working in a failure analysis or design role<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated project management and team leadership skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience managing product and customer experience quality at a cross functional level<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with Lean or Six Sigma programs and Statistical Quality Control processes<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Solid understanding of and experience applying problem solving tools including root cause analysis, statistical tools and processes, and design of experiments<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to clearly summarize quality data and trends, and to create reports and presentations for all levels of internal audiences and use them to prioritize and drive action on to solve issues<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Willingness to travel domestically and internationally up to 25% of the time<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiarity with SQL, Python or equivalent<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong background using Excel and Tableau (a strong Plus)<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>The knowledge and experience required to work safely with high power equipment in the lab and field  480VAC and 500-1000VDC<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Familiarity with manufacturing and managing CMs<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $70,000 to $152,000. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Senior Manager, PCBA Design<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Research, design and develop contemporary; processor, networking, user interface, sensor, safety, and charging electronics for ChargePoint's industry-leading products.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Deliver designs optimized for multiple dimensions including; cost, reliability and feature richness.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Drive system architectures and distill hardware components into subassemblies, circuits and board designs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to full-scale system design and see those systems all the way through to volume manufacturing and field deployment.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Strong electrical\u002Felectronic design skills and understanding of system level engineering tradeoffs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience designing with a variety of the latest; embedded processors, interfaces, peripheral devices and sensors.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Expertise in the design and implementation of: high-speed interfaces, processors, memory, power, analog sensing and control circuits.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be inventive, curious, and creative as well as fanatical about cost, quality, and building market leading products.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Able to drive hardware designs across software, mechanical, power and thermal boundaries to assure great results.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience managing and driving JDM projects.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Must have a successful record developing complex products placed into production.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>10+ years of experience developing electronic products.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bachelor's degree or higher in electrical engineering or related discipline.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $105,000 to $207,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.<\u002Fp> \n <p> If there is a match between your experiences\u002Fskills and the Company needs, we will contact you <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Operations Program Manager, NPI<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Become part of the excitement, join the Charge Point team as we build the future. Responsible for cross functional program management activities throughout the whole product life-cycle in Operations. The New Product Operations Manager is also required to work closely with extended teams in managing, communicating, and following through activities to bring up new products and sustain production, seeing through production all the way till EOL life-cycle.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Management of projects from product development phase to factory introduction and ramp<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lead cross-functional teams responsible for qualifying and transferring new products at CM sites<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Follow up on BOM, spec, documentation releases to enable the Operations team to support the NPI builds or change management implementation timely<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Resolving complex cross-functional problems and issues<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Establish methodologies for achieving quality set deliverables per Charge Point Corporate guideline. Work with manufacturer on Quality, Delivery and Cost<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Liaise with marketing \u002F sales to support customer beta and change submission. Consolidate build requirements for NPI and Pilot phase<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with Material and Planning team to align material, logistics, forecast planning, fulfillment and system readiness<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Facilitates the resolutions of complex team issues or determines direction to take based on risk factors, builds consensus, maintains process focus, and overcomes barriers for the team<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage build and test (manufacturing &amp; qualification) plans and resources during execution; objective is to achieve cost, quality\u002F Reliability, and schedule goals<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Plan factory capacity and lead CapEx equipment budget. Ensure available tooling and test equipment capacity to support initial high volume manufacturing after program transfer.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with Quality to ensure RMA is set up for new product \u002F new manufacturing partner<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work closely with Product and Engineering team on understanding requirements and be able to communicate requirements and schedules to facilitate technical readiness with operations teams<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Bachelor's Degree in Industrial Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Electronic Engineering<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 5 - 8 years Project Management role in complex and fast moving manufacturing environment is desired<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Very familiar with inventory and BOM management software and tools.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Able to travel as required within a short notice<\u002Fli> \n  <li>PMP is preferred but not essential<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in manufacturing, process engineering or product development<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong interpersonal skills and ability to present to management<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Extraordinary ability to build relationships<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Clear, consistent communication<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Use data to drive decisions and be willing to take action<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Enthusiastic and motivated<\u002Fli> \n  <li>High level of detail while running several work-streams<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Technical expertise and prior OEM management experience<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to be part of creating an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are looking for a Senior FP&amp;A Manager to join our growing team. This is an opportunity to partner with the Operations and Supply Chain business leaders to drive strategic COGS and gross margin planning, an extremely critical metric for our Company. This role reports to the VP of FP&amp;A and is a key member of the FP&amp;A team. The mission of our team is to enable strategic executive and Board-level as well as tactical decision making for the company through financial modeling, fact-based analyses and interpretation of key business and financial trends.<\u002Fp> \n <p> This individual will primarily serve as the Finance Business Partner for the Operations department and will own the budgeting and reporting for overall company gross margins. They will have the opportunity to help identify risks and opportunities to achieving quarterly gross margin targets, lead cross-functional cost improvement initiatives and drive accountability.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i> What You'll Do<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Drive and manage the annual budgeting process and maintain accurate and updated forecasts for COGS and Gross Margins while working closely with the Operations leaders<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Create detailed models to track gross margin progress within the financial quarter, and also forecast long-term gross margins<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop models to forecast inventory, capex requirements and capacity planning<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Build management reports, KPIs and dashboards<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop models to translate sales forecasts into production plans<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Create department level reporting to help track and manage spending and headcount decisions<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Create training for operations employees to foster understanding of key metrics and gross margin implications<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Identify key cost reduction opportunities, and lead cross-functional initiatives to drive margin improvements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Continuously focus on automating and streamlining the FP&amp;A processes<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop financial models and analyses to support strategic initiatives<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b><i>What We're Looking For<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>An advanced understanding of corporate financial planning, modeling, reporting and analysis<\u002Fli> \n  <li>5+ years experience with technology hardware company supporting the Manufacturing\u002FOperations departments<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong understanding of COGS and gross margins<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A high degree of analytical capability with the proven ability to identify business challenges, structure recommendations and provide insights to enable high-level strategic vision<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or Finance; MBA, CPA, and CFA highly preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with Adaptive Insights or similar planning tools, and Netsuite a plus<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Senior UX Applications Manager<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Work closely with product managers, developers, fellow designers and customers to translate business requirements into intuitive interface solutions for upcoming releases<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Redefine the user experience direction for existing products<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop process flows, wire frames and mockups with accompanying interaction rules<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Help plan, coordinate and conduct user research, customer validation, and usability testing sessions<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with cross disciplinary teams to ensure team members understand the design and how it translates the requirements into an effective user interface<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Effectively present and persuasively convey design solutions to team members and executive management<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Qualifications and Experience<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>3-5 years experience in user interface and interaction design<\u002Fli> \n  <li>BA\u002FBS Degree in Human Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, Human Factors or related field of study. Master's degree preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven track record in defining the user experience for web and mobile applications<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent interpersonal communication, brainstorming and presentation skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to effectively collaborate with key stakeholders from business, marketing and engineering teams<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Able to strike a balance between tactical problem solving goals and strategic, long-term solutions<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA or US, Remote<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $70,000 to $154,000. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Business Systems Manager<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Provide support and maintenance of various financial applications for internal use (particularly Netsuite, Avalara, Expensify, Coupa and other finance applications)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work hands-on in Netsuite ERP to triage and resolve production support issues and implement &amp; deploy minor enhancement requests, including<\u002Fli> \n  <li>custom records, workflows, scripts, Saved Searches, Bundles<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Partner with business stakeholders to gather requirements and collaborate with Business system team members to identify and document system solutions<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage testing of custom deployments and upgrades in these environments<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Collaborate with offshore production support team to appropriately assign tickets and project tasks<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Monitor performance of Netsuite integrations (e.g., Coupa, Avalara, Blackline, Expensify, Fixed Assets.) and resolve data integrity issues<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Analyze impact of vendors' scheduled upgrades, and send notifications to users for configurations, and customizations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintain up-to-date knowledge of system functionality, features, and tools<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with requirement gathering for Robotic Process Automation process is a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience working with a public company is a plus<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>The ideal candidate would be self-motivated, result oriented, customer focused individual who enjoys challenging environments to achieve superior results.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>BS in a technical, business, or other analytical field required with 3-years' experience in Netsuite ERP system as business analyst or support admin<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Functional knowledge of Netsuite required; Avalara, Coupa, Blackline preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of software development and programming practices<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of financial report writing customizations and creation of saved searches in NetSuite<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Basic understanding of accounting processes (Order to Cash, Procure to Pay, GL reporting, fixed asset management, invoicing, remittance payments, Month End close)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work with Netsuite support as required to address system bugs, performance issues, and enhancement requests<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated ability to design and implement technology-enabled business solutions in client-facing and team leadership roles (e.g., functional lead, work-stream lead, etc.)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to communicate with internal end-users in cases to support issue resolution<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to document test scripts, execute QA testing, and capture results<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to collaborate with business stakeholders and coordinate user acceptance testing with cross functional teams<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of Bank Payment system integration with Netsuite<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of SOX compliance &amp; Segregation of Duties reports &amp; have an experience working with Internal and external auditors<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong analytical skills and ability to solve complex issues<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong documentation skills<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> US Remote<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $60,000 to $101,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <b> Reports To<\u002Fb>\n  <br> Director, Strategic Sourcing\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  <b>What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb>\n  <br> The Global Supply Manager CapEx is the end-to-end owner of sourcing strategy and execution, acting as the business representative of ChargePoint to external supply partners and as a key commercial authority on internal cross-functional teams. Applying a deep understanding of manufacturing processes and supplier behavior, the GSM is responsible for aligning internal and external stakeholders to anticipate supply risks, drive mitigations, and deliver optimum value to ChargePoint. This role is a high-growth opportunity to shape not only ChargePoint's future product realization but also how the company makes decisions and delivers on its ambitions.\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  <b>What You Will Be Bring<\u002Fb>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <ul>\n  <li>Strong understanding of strategic sourcing toolkit, including product life-cycle, negotiation, contracts, and cross-functional coordination<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Nose for identifying and capturing cost savings opportunities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to triage multiple inbound requests and drive issues to closure<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Passion for crafting data-driven recommendations and building coalitions to put into action<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent communication and situational awareness<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Creative, proactive problem-solving<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Eye for process improvement and comfort working without a script<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Professionalism and integrity<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n  <b>Requirements<\u002Fb>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <ul>\n  <li>12+ years supply chain experience, including 7+ years directly responsible for supplier performance during NPI<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong knowledge of supply chain management tools and best practices<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong understanding of Capital Expenditure (CapEx) sourcing<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bachelor's degree or higher in Finance, Supply Chain, Engineering, or related<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience sourcing custom mechanical or power electronics strongly preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with capital equipment NPI a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Willingness to travel ~20% globally<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $85,000 to $152,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Senior Manager, Systems Engineering<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is looking for a creative and versatile <b>Senior Electrical Engineer<\u002Fb> to help ensure ChargePoint's DC chargers meet high design, development and production quality. The role will operate in a cross-functional role to drive many aspects of ChargePoint's high power DC charger products.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Act as a cross-functional team member closing the technical gaps in engineering, manufacturing, and field operation.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist in solving ongoing challenges in manufacturing, test, field operations working closely with engineering team.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Driving quality of the product from mechanical, electrical, product design, hardware, software, and ease of use perspectives.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with manufacturing test team to understand the failure, work with engineering to find root cause, devise a solution and drive the solution to closure.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>works cross-functionally to resolve early (architectural) and late (lab, test &amp; validation) dependencies of Systems Engineering team.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in leading a team that understands distributed electrical systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Empower simple to moderately complex test fixtures for REL and Factory.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Establish internal test standards and methods for all aspects of EV chargers: cables, enclosures, labels and finishes, PCBAs, etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Test and validate the functionality of full product as defined in the PRD\u002FERD<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with Safety and Regulatory to troubleshoot and fix any issues that arise during compliance testing<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>B.S. or M.S. in Electrical Engineering<\u002Fli> \n  <li>5+ years of experience in electrical or electronic system design, validation, and testing. Power Electronics background a big plus.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, including executive presentations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with Scopes, DVMs and hi-pot testers, IR cameras and other tools and equipment for troubleshooting.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience working with x-functional teams: mechanical, software, and test.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Deep understanding in product design testing and characterization.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience testing high power 240-480VAC \u002F 500-1000VDC products desired.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Current knowledge of industry standards for consumer and industrial products.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of EV charging standards a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiarity with environmental, reliability, compliance (NEC, UL and IEEE standards), and safety requirements for electrical equipment.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Travel<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Up to 20% domestic and international travel may be expected for this position.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $70,000 to $149,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. directly.<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer.<br> Applicants only - Recruiting agencies do not contact.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <p><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Senior Director of Embedded Platform Software &amp; HW Test Engineering<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As a Solution Architect, you will work to help the team architect, build, and deploy embedded software solutions.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <b> Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Working with product management, hardware, regulatory and other teams to generate requirements; subsequently work with engineering teams to develop software design, etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Take projects \u002F programs through the different stages of development - from concept, through development builds, to production and beyond<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate software delivery schedules and drive teams to meet committed delivery dates<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Collaborate with members of the firmware, software QA, cloud, hardware, mechanical, regulatory, test, product and support teams during product design and implementation<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Actively managing scrum and agile methodologies<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Evangelize and promote engineering best practices<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Demonstrated ability to deliver and support cloud-connected software running on commercial\u002Findustrial hardware<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated ability and inclination to make critical system-level design decisions and drive projects from start to finish<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with working through bring up phase of new embedded systems \u002F technology products<\u002Fli> \n  <li>8+ years of experience working on embedded system products using C\u002FC++, and shell scripting (bash or equivalent)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>BS in Computer Science or equivalent (MS preferred)<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Preferred to have<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Exposure in connectivity architecture using Wireless (Cellular, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and NFC), and wired (Ethernet, CAN) interfaces a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>C\u002FC++ coding in a Linux environment; modern C++ is preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working with EV \u002F EVSE products is a big plus<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $85,000 to $196,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team.
