<h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Director, Technical Content Development and Localization<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> The Content Creator will combine text, audio, animation, images, and video to create educational content for internal and external customers. This role will coordinate with cross functional teams to incorporate best practices, examples, and other value enhancing ideas to promote customer and user adoption. You will collaborate with technical writers, instructional designers, and illustrators to develop interactive and impactful training experiences. To be successful at ChargePoint this person must be highly motivated, self-directed, and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Create tutorial videos including script, audio, screen recording, onscreen design elements, etc. and ensure content is updated on a regular basis.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Collaborate with instructional designers and other stakeholders to develop and load content within the learning management system (LMS), MadCap Central, and\u002For other delivery platforms.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Design and deliver creative content to build knowledge of end users to successfully use ChargePoint solutions and applications.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop digital communications content, such as infographics, how to videos, microlearning moments, etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prototype, develop, and test learner-centric digital learning experiences and materials in a variety of delivery modalities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Run UAT on new content, systems, process, or feature ideas.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Continuously explore innovative ways of utilizing design material to engage audiences while transferring skills\u002Fknowledge and driving sustainable behavior change.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Minimum of 2-4 years of working experience in content creation with specialty in educational video design and development<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with video editing, trimming footage, and inserting graphics using modern editing software required (Camtasia, Final Cut Pro, and\u002For Adobe Premiere)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient with image manipulation using Photoshop, GIMP, Illustrator, or similar applications<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to write effective copy, instructional text, audio, and video scripts<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated ability to distill information from subject matter experts and translate it into training relevant to target audience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiarity with authoring tools such as such as MadCap Flare, Articulate, or Captivate; HTML and CSS experience a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be able to manage own projects and workflows<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bachelor's degree preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of Jira, Confluence, or similar project management tools is a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work on multiple projects concurrently while meeting tight deadlines<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p> Location: Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> <p><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> With electric vehicles (EVs) expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software, and mobile solutions for every charging need. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities, and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on EV charging and established a business model that's been validated by more than a decade in business and thousands of customers. As now a public company, we remain focused on broadening our market leadership and building on years of innovation. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to build our all-electric future and dominate a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Senior Manager Engineering Project Specialist<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> The Change Manager will evaluate, analyze, and organize changes for all products (Embedded Software and Hardware). Changes are coming in from various sources like cost reduction, end of life components, design changes for supporting new features or field failures for existing products in the field. All these changes need to be evaluated and grouped into logical buckets for effective and efficient implementation.<\u002Fp> \n <p> This proactive leader will work very closely with design engineers, program management, product managers, operations, material management and other key stakeholders to understand , track, and communicate changes, document and track risks and dependencies to ensure projects are progressing to committed schedule.<\u002Fp> \n <p> The Change Manager will play a critical role in the over-all improvement of change management processes. The Change Manager will have in depth understanding of Over-all product lifecycle phases and have the engineering knowledge and experience understand and communicate technical details to non-technical stakeholders.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Develop and maintain a quantitative priority assignment system for ranking sustaining issues by their impact to the company. (RPN system)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Be the standard-bearer for the cross-functional team's agreed workflows, management systems, and operating rules. You will keep the team disciplined on how we manage issues and projects as they arise. Delegate tasks required to both internal and external teams as appropriate ensuring all aspects of engineering, regulatory approvals, testing, submissions, and supply chain operations are completed per plan even though stakeholders are not directly reporting to him\u002Fher.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proactively identify risks to execution and drive the team to implement mitigations and escalate as needed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Take a leadership role in understanding and driving engineering changes from initiation to execution to meet company goals in timeline, cost, and scope. Implement proper change management controls to document, review, approve\u002Freject, and report any changes to the plan<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Mentor and guide other members of the core team as needed<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Regular Project Reporting to Management and Stakeholders<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Measure project performance to identify areas for improvement<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Utilize industry best practices, techniques, and standards throughout entire project execution<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to operate effectively in a fast-moving high-pressure environment<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Must be highly Organized with very good analytical and complex problem-solving skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must have excellent interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to highly influence a cross functional team<\u002Fli> \n  <li>8 years of product design, program management and manufacturing or combination experience.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>8 years of experience related to embedded software, regulatory, electrical and mechanical engineering, manufacturing and end to end product development. Such as PCBA design, mechanical design<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Direct experience managing engineering changes in a global location with different time zones<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of Project Management methodologies and certifications, preferably waterfall and agile project management.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficient at creating and tracking complex development schedules, managing issues and tracking bugs using modern tools such as Confluence and Jira.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Possess an ability to take large, complex projects and break them down into manageable pieces, develop functional specifications, then deliver them in a timely manner<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Bonus Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Knowledge of n Engineering CAD tools such as siemens NX and PCBA CAD tools<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of PLM and ERP tools such as Arena and NetSuite<\u002Fli> \n  <li>PMP certification is a plus<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $70,000 to $163,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Senior Director, Software QA<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> ChargePoint is hiring a Leader of Embedded Software QA to own and direct Embedded Software QA automation for ChargePoint's array of charging stations and their integration with ChargePoint Cloud. Additionally, you will own software validation on charging platforms and partner with internal\u002Fexternal stakeholders for vehicle interoperability testing across our various charging stations.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Hire, mentor, and motivate a team of world class software QA engineers<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Introduce and implement industry QA best practices to the teams and contribute to improving the team's overall functional craft<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Plan, scope, and manage the creation of automation frameworks, test plans, test cases, and other QA documentation<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Roll up your sleeves to perform troubleshooting and hands-on testing as needed<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Collaborate cross-functionally to understand support\u002Ffield issues and drive solutions<\u002Fli> \n  <li>File and track bugs from opening to closure after verification<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Create Reports on defects and manage follow-through as necessary to complete the testing cycle<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide timely status updates to ChargePoint leadership and manage the team in making decisions about automation milestones, framework changes, and software release-readiness<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>10+ years of QA experience with 3+ years in a management capacity<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Preferred experience in managing QA leads or managers<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong team building and empowerment skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with Agile development processes, including experience with Atlassian tools (Confluence and Jira)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to communicate effectively to all stakeholders and to build relationships at all levels of the organization<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Comfortable as a \"hands-on\" manager and willing to roll up your sleeves to get things done<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills while exercising sound judgement<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experienced in management of lab and automation bench resources<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Technical Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Linux &amp; Python skills in the Embedded domain<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $115,000 to $203,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Senior Manager, Quality Assurance<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> ChargePoint is hiring an Embedded\u002FPlatform Software QA Engineer with significant testing and automation experience. As a member of the team, you will participate in the design, development, and testing of platform\u002Fembedded software features on our networked EV charging stations spanning across areas such as driver experience, EV charging protocols, and networking. The Platform Software QA Team focuses on an array of charging solutions comprising Home, Commercial AC, DC Fast and Ultrafast DC stations, being deployed across the world.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Create test plans, write test cases, and other QA documents based on platform software requirements and specifications<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform hands-on testing of platform\u002Fembedded software<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Automate test cases and processes using Python<\u002Fli> \n  <li>File and track bugs from opening to closure after verification<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Report defects and follow-through as necessary to complete the testing cycle<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide timely status updates and assist the team in making decisions about release-readiness<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Collaborate cross-functionally to understand support\u002Ffield issues and drive solutions<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Excellent communication, testing and troubleshooting skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>5-7 years of Embedded\u002FPlatform Software testing experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Linux and Programming (preferably Python) expertise<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Board level testing (if any, will be an added bonus)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Modem\u002Fnetworking experience preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Self-motivated with ability to work cross-functionally<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bachelors or Masters in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $70,000 to $146,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Reports To: Sr. Director, Product Portfolio &amp; Strategy<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Are you a highly analytical, strategic thinker? Do you enjoy dissecting business models and daydream about ways to increase adoption? Do you want to do that at a mission-driven company that is transforming transportation by enabling everyone to drive electric?<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint's Product Portfolio team provides strategic direction and defines solutions to serve our commercial and fleet customers and EV (Electric Vehicle) Driver users. Our portfolio of solutions addresses the needs of various segments through a combination of hardware, software, services, and purchase models that match our customers' goals.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are looking for an intellectually curious, analytical, creative, collaborative, user-centric, and strategic thinker who can communicate complex concepts in a structured way and drive alignment across a wide array of stakeholders.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> As the global <b>Product Portfolio Director for Services<\u002Fb>, you will lead a team to develop and manage services products that help our customers and users get the most out of their ChargePoint solutions. We are building a global portfolio of support, maintenance, professional, financial, and energy services that can efficiently serve customers across all our verticals and geographies.<\u002Fp> \n <p> As an integral part of the product team, you will work closely with customers, marketers, sales and business development leaders, experienced product managers, and cross-functional stakeholders to define the future of networked EV Charging deployment and operation at scale.<\u002Fp> \n <p> <b>In this role you will:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Craft a customer-centric product vision and strategy for a world-class global services product portfolio.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lead a team of services product managers to evolve ChargePoint's service offerings, optimizing for rapid adoption, high customer satisfaction and retention.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Apply expertise in business strategy, product planning, customer discovery and product development to orchestrate execution on the solution vision.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Serve as the voice of our installation and field service partners within the product organization, charting a strategy to maximize ChargePoint's solution value delivered through installers, electrical distributors, and field service partners.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lead in a highly matrixed cross-functional organization across Product, Marketing, Sales and Service, and Operations teams, aligning on market opportunity and needs, business priorities, and guiding the company as solutions are planned and introduced to the market.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Track market trends and competitive offerings, interface with customers and sales teams to ensure product direction and capabilities meet market needs and customer satisfaction goals.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p> <b>What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>12+ years of experience, or 10- years plus an MBA, in consulting, business development, service\u002Foperational leadership, corporate strategy, or product management roles.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Domain expertise in professional services, support, and field services delivery<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with multinational service product strategies; software attached to hardware is a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to synthesize qualitative and quantitative insights, frame strategic choices, and drive decision making with a data driven approach.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong Excel, Tableau, Salesforce.com, or other equivalent data analysis tools; financial modeling ability within a business context.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience working in less mature, hyper growth, business environments where you contributed to setting up and improving business practices.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to juggle multiple priorities, seamlessly moving between strategy and execution<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to navigate ambiguity, work independently and be able to chart direction of complex, concurrent projects\u002Fprograms.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated ability to build cross-functional consensus and apply business judgement to complex strategic and operational challenges. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to build and mentor a team<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to manage multiple and diverse stakeholders across businesses and leadership <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Senior Manager of Test Engineering<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> ChargePoint is looking for an experienced ICT Test Engineer to help drive our new PCBA designs to be test friendly with maximum coverage to catch defects early in the builds. Providing early on feedback to the design team and ensuring the Chargepoint DFT guidelines are being followed throughout the product development life cycle.<\u002Fp> \n <p> This engineer will also be responsible for reviewing daily test failures, analyzing and debugging failures, providing debug guidance to the CM techs and engineers, implementing, and debugging new test programs and evaluating test coverage of CM defined tests: AOI, X-ray, Flying Probe, ICT, B-Scan and Test jet.<\u002Fp> \n <p> This role requires an engineer who is self-driven, and highly motivated to gain in-depth knowledge of ChargePoint's products and test processes. He or she will be ChargePoint's first line of defense at SMT.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experienced ICT Development for mid to high complexity PCBAs<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Evaluate equipment failures, manage spare parts inventory and repairs<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Daily tracking of test failures including categorizing them to root cause<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Escalate new and unresolved test and failure issues and risks to the ChargePoint Quality and TE teams<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure that our CM is thoroughly and accurately diagnosing and addressing issues<\u002Fli> \n  <li>FMEA experience, preferably experience driving product PFMEAs from factory test perspective.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Feedback and influence with design teams and test teams to correct product defects, test station and process issues<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Development experience in ICT Test development space.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Periodic monitoring of test data for statistical trends to detect component, manufacturing and measurement system changes occurring through their lifecycles<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Create and implement ECOs for production SW\u002FFW updates in the factory<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with Vendors, CMS and CP test engineers to validate new tests  coverage reports, gauge R&amp;R, SPC analysis results.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Bachelors or associates degree in engineering or related technical field or extensive industry experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>8-10 years of industry experience, 4-6 years of hands on ICT Test development experience.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience working in an EMS facility and directing technicians and operators<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to read circuit schematics and to debug PCBA and electro-mechanical systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experienced user of electronic test equipment, power supplies and signal acquisition devices.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experienced with configuring and maintaining custom test systems (HW and SW)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Willingness to travel domestically and internationally up to 20% of the time<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $70,000 to $122,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p> Director, Sustaining Manufacturing Engineering and Operation<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> ChargePoint is looking for a leader in operation leading factory capacity planning, budgeting, forecasting, and communicate requirements and schedules to facilitate technical readiness with supply chain teams. This position will work closely with our manufacturing partners as well as our internal development and operations teams to deliver robust products that meet ChargePoint's manufacturability, cost, quality and delivery objectives. You will be managing both NPI and sustaining products and from new product introduction through EOL. You'll interact with specialists from other teams like Product Design, Technical Program Managers, Test Engineering, Manufacture Engineering team and others. You will communicate frequently and effectively to peers and leadership teams to keep them apprised of the status of the programs.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> A successful candidate must have proven experience in operation management of complex supply chain and systems. A CapEx team member has the ability to impact ChargePoint's bottom line. The role includes the following activities:<\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Understand the technical aspects of Equipment and Tooling &amp; Fixtures<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Identify and drive reuse (fungibility) and cost-optimization opportunities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Data analysis to identify and parse process-related opportunities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Run ROI analysis<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Plan capacity and manage factory equipment budget.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Drive standardization in asset naming convention across suppliers and internal teams<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Build relationships, drive cross-functional teams on consensus of opportunities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Organize projects including schedules, teams, and motivation. Be able to think multiple steps ahead to mitigate project risks.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Clear and concise communication of Budget status to management team.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage Equipment and Tooling &amp; Fixture forecasting and kickoff process.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage spares and maintenance plans to ensure equipment uptime<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Influence product manufacturability, testability, and supply chain responsiveness in pursuit of low cost and flexibility while stewarding quality<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Travel internationally to support systems &amp; tools adoption, and early project engagement.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Bachelor\u002FMaster degree in engineering preferred, MBA are consider a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>5-8 years direct related hands-on experience and know-how with fast paced, product design and product commercialization companies. Been through 3+ product life cycles from inception to EOL<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge &amp; direct experience in NPI operations and Sustaining Operation<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Flexibility and adaptability to work in a dynamic environment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Program management experience, with excellent written and verbal English communication skills required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Able to communicate up and across (cross-functionally) succinctly and effectively<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work with limited supervision<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Up to 25% international and domestic travel may be require<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $85,000 to $152,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><br> Senior Director, Software Engineering<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> The Software Engineering Manager will be responsible for managing and driving the execution of the cloud development team and provide broad technical and architectural leadership to the team. They will work closely with Product Management, Design, QA, and other software engineering teams.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Manage and grow the Cloud development team with talented engineers while maintaining a healthy and positive work environment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with other technical leaders throughout the organization to ensure that the software design of individual projects is aligned with the organization's long-term architecture goals.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with product and program management, quality assurance, and other engineering managers to prioritize product features.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Solid understanding of Cloud Architecture and Technologies and proven track record in implementing and overseeing a medium to large scale cloud-based solution.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent grasp on architecture patterns, design patterns, and design principles and applying them in the design and implementation of software solutions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Drive execution of various projects and technical issues. This includes project planning and having the intuition to shift priorities amid a rapidly changing business environment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review and contribute to software design specifications to implement and satisfy product requirements.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Mentor, advise, and support software leads during implementation, clarifying requirements, participating in code reviews, and generally ensuring that the implementation conforms to the software design and meets product requirements.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Evangelize code quality through writing well-architected, structured code, unit tests, and practicing good engineering hygiene.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Drive and facilitate technical innovation and constant improvement in the infrastructure and reduction of technical debt.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Experience in leading a team of 4+ engineers.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in cloud software development, server-side development, and full-stack projects.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Practical experience in at least one server-side programming language (PHP, Java, Go, Python, etc.).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven record of managing and building software engineering teams.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven record of software development and contributions to software development processes.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Great engineering skills and strong CS fundamentals.Great verbal and written communication skills.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $115,000 to $247,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.<\u002Fp> \n <p> If there is a match between your experiences\u002Fskills and the Company needs, we will contact you <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Senior Firmware Manager<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What will you be doing?<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> ChargePoint is looking for an outstanding engineer interested in applying a broad skill-set toward building cutting-edge software for a next generation vehicle charging platform. You will architect, design, implement, and test new systems in a rapidly evolving problem-space.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Senior Director of Hardware<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> ChargePoint is looking for a creative and versatile Lead power electronics engineer to help ensure that our products meet high design, development and production quality. The role will play a key cross-functional role to drive many aspects including developing and production of high quality power systems.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Architect and design high power dc systems for consumer and commercial EV chargers.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lead a team of engineers in development of high power AC to DC and DC to DC converters.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Design and develop advanced soft switching 40-100 kW, up to 1500 VDC multi-level LLC converters.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Design and develop multi-level 100-200 kW, up to 1500 VDC four quadrant grid tie PFC inverters.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Responsible for all aspect of product design, including modelling, key component selection, schematic capture, PCB layout, code development, magnetics design, thermal design, regulatory and compliance considerations, DFM.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Utilize power topologies such at LLC, phase shifted full bridge, flyback, forward, multi-level converters including PFC (single phase and three phase) and associated techniques such as ZVS\u002FZCS.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Model power designs using analysis tools such as PLECS, Matlab and spice. Create designs based on both off the shelf integrated circuit controllers, FPGAs \u002F PLDs and DSP digital control using embedded software development experience.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work effectively with cross-functional teams to resolve early (architectural) and late (lab, test &amp; validation).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure high reliability of the product under stress conditions and environments for extended periods.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>B.S. required (M.S. desired) in Engineering (electrical, computer or electronics)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>10+ years of experience in bringing power electronics products to market:<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong electrical\u002Felectronic design skills and understanding of system level engineering tradeoffs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience designing AC\u002FDC DC\u002FDC power conversion systems.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Able to drive solutions across software, mechanical, power and thermal boundaries to assure great results.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience working with x-functional teams: mechanical, software, and test.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Current knowledge of industry standards for consumer and industrial products.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of EV charging standards a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Some travel is expected.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p> #LI-CPMS1<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $105,000 to $205,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.<\u002Fp> \n <p> If there is a match between your experiences\u002Fskills and the Company needs, we will contact you <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Reporting to:<\u002Fb> Senior Director, Public Policy  North America<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> <\u002Fb><b>Position Summary<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> The Sr. Manager of Federal Policy is responsible for federal policy efforts to advance transportation electrification and ChargePoint's business interests. Must be goal-motivated, adaptable, a strategic thinker, and detail-oriented. Successful candidates will have experience working with Members of Congress and the Executive Branch, analyzing legislation, and advancing policy objectives in energy or transportation fields. This is not an entry-level position.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> Duties and Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Spearhead ChargePoint advocacy and engagement with Congress and the Executive Branch.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Track, monitor, and analyze federal legislation and policy to develop ChargePoint policy positions and strategy for response.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Represent ChargePoint in meetings, hearings, and stakeholder groups, in coordination with ChargePoint policy directors and consultants.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proactively build coalitions of diverse organizations with common goals to achieve policy outcomes of mutual interest.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop written comments, letters of support or opposition, oral testimony, and presentations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure effective collaboration with internal teams, consultants, and trade associations on messaging, policy development, and strategy.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Qualifications<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Minimum of 7 years experience in federal affairs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bachelor's degree required. Master's degree preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Track record of successfully navigating Congress and the Administration.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to speak publicly and write clearly, accurately, and persuasively.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to identify, build rapport, and keep contact with key influencers in multiple jurisdictions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to effectively work under tight deadlines and manage projects independently.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent people skills and an upbeat and enthusiastic attitude.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong organizational skills and keen attention to detail.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong computer skills including Excel and PowerPoint.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to travel as needed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bachelor's degree required, advanced degree preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven ability to converse with and persuade stakeholders at all levels of management, including sales directors and C-suite executives.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong organizational skills, ability to \"manage up\" and keen attention to detail.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Washington D.C.<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $102,000 to $184,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles (EVs) expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on EV charging and established a business model that's been validated by more than a decade in business and thousands of customers. As now a public company, we remain focused on broadening our market leadership and building on years of innovation. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to build our all-electric future and dominate a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Senior Director of Test Engineering<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> ChargePoint Test Engineering team designs, develops, validates, and delivers to internal customers test solutions incorporating complex hardware, firmware, and software. We are looking for an experienced Senior Test Program Manager to work with test engineers and technicians, GSM\u002Flogistics teams, and outside vendors through the full lifecycle of Test projects, from concept to development, validation, factory deployment, and sustaining. The Senior Test Program Manager is responsible for establishing and executing project integrated schedules and drive the execution of test development and delivery projects. The successful candidate will be collaborative, open, transparent, and team-oriented with a focus on team empowerment &amp; shared responsibility, flexibility, continuous learning, and a culture of automation.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b> This role will be responsible for the following activities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Develop and manage the project plan, align with the project core team to map the development, validation, and deployment of test stations at various maturity levels (Proto, EVT, DVT, Production)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Be responsible for daily project management through the test solution life cycle of design, development, validation, and factory release<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Establish cross functional relationships to gather test requirements and defining the test coverage prioritization by build<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Partner with test engineering management to facilitate all aspects of projects: prioritize, schedule, track, proactively manage and communicate status of projects; manage dependencies and blockers<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure Test Engineering resources are adequately allocated by project milestones<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage and coordinate the development of the factory test flow for all test stations to be deployed on the production lines<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Interface with outside vendors, track their progress, and ensure timely execution of the project from requirements to delivery of specified test solution<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with GSM teams to ensure that documentation and specifications for test station development and duplication are clearly established and mass production scaling plans are in line with manufacturing capacity<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate the projects and their interdependencies between new and sustaining project plans<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Present the state of Test Engineering to upper management on a regular cadence<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Capture lessons learned and drive continuous improvements across projects<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Enforce processes throughout the project cycle  scrums and agile ceremony meetings, demos, and releases<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Execute commit gates for test development and factory release<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintain master project Confluence page tying all aspects of the project together<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Project management\u002FProject leadership background in a technology company. Well versed in current electronics test strategies (AOI, ICT, Functional and FATP)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prior experience in High Voltage or Power Supplies space is a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experienced in engineering validation and test methodologies<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Understanding of rapid product development and product lifecycles<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to extract data from chaos and parse information for leadership reviews<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform risk assessments and balance deliverables against schedules<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Successfully built partnerships with CMs and vendors<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in establishing statement of work for vendors<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Create and implement ECOs for production SW\u002FFW updates in the factory Coordinate with SW teams to manage factory test SW release plan<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Bachelor's degree in engineering or related technical field (PMP or MBA a plus)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>3+ years of program\u002Fproject management experience in Test Engineering, including tracking tester development and delivery using Agile tools and metrics<\u002Fli> \n  <li>4+ years' experience in Test engineering of electronic systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experienced user of electronic test equipment such as bed of nails fixtures, power supplies and signal acquisition devices<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experienced with configuring and maintaining custom test systems (HW and SW)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to juggle between multiple competing priorities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to collate and present data to leadership<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Willingness to travel domestically and internationally up to 15% of the time<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $70,000 to $154,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.<\u002Fp> \n <p> If there is a match between your experiences\u002Fskills and the Company needs, we will contact you <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Director, Strategic Program Development<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Analyze potential charging locations and forecast driver utilization levels by leveraging existing data from the ChargePoint network, understanding of the use case and business dynamics at the site, nearby charging alternatives, local\u002Fregional dynamics, traffic patterns and other geospatial information related to the site.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Evaluate site host properties for the proper placement of EV chargers, considering factors such as site host preferences, where electricity is distributed onto the property, how close electrical supply is to areas under consideration for EV charger installation, availability of enough 3 phase power needed for product installation, safety, driver experience, accessibility requirements etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Engage with large, multi-site property owners and businesses to pitch complex charging projects at various properties<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Review financial models and work with customers or potential site hosts to clearly articulate the business case or impacts of owning or hosting fast chargers at their sites<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Present and negotiate terms for site host agreements, getting to contract closure in a timely manner to meet program deadlines<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with internal legal counsel and property owners to negotiate and close site agreements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Present and provide potential site hosts and customers with hosting proposals and product\u002Fproject\u002Fsupport service materials<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Build relationships with landlords, local jurisdictions, and utility planners<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Record and track milestones to ensure projects are completed in a timely manner<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate and perform site walks to guide cost effective and expedient site builds<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate and manage construction contractors. This includes cost negotiation, contract management, communication and coordination of project activities. Scheduled weekly meetings and diligent follow-ups are required to ensure construction related activities advance at all locations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate and manage relationships with key contracts at partner electric utilities. Scheduled weekly meetings and diligent follow-ups are required to ensure utility activities advance at all locations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide the team with weekly updates on the pipeline in individual geographic territories<\u002Fli> \n  <li>This role requires at least 60% travel, mostly by car<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>You have a passion for vehicle electrification with a good knowledge of the automotive industry and electric vehicle charging dynamics<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven track record of closing deals with both small business owners and large, multinational properties<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Understanding of power profiles, construction drawings, and permit packages<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work remotely, effectively work under tight deadlines and manage projects independently<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A diligent reporter that takes time to document activities with a proficiency using tracking tools such as SalesForce.com and other project tracking tools<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven ability to converse with and persuade stakeholders at all levels of management, including C-suite<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong business acumen with the ability to dive deep into decisions to understand economic impacts and ROI as well as market and competitive implications.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Outstanding communications skills and sales polish, with the ability to communicate at all levels internally and externally<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent analytical skills with the ability to understand and articulate payback models to customers<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>B.S or M.S in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, or equivalent<\u002Fli> \n  <li>8+ years' experience in sales and program management, preferably in electrical and civil infrastructure deployment on commercial properties or related infrastructure deployment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Keen understanding of electrical power consumption, construction drawings, and permit packages<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work remotely, effectively work under tight deadlines and manage projects independently<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven ability to converse with and persuade stakeholders at all levels of management, including C-suite<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong business acumen with the ability to dive deep into decisions to understand economic impacts and ROI as well as market and competitive implications.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Outstanding presentation, oral, and written communications skills and sales polish, with the ability to communicate at all levels internally and externally<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Detailed tracking, reporting, and managing capabilities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent project\u002Fprogram management skills and ability to track and manage complex customer relationship and activities at 20  30 sites at a time<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience should include some of: electrical engineering, construction management, telecommunications, information technology, software development, technical writing<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>US Remote<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p>ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $58,000 to $131,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Site Reliability Engineering Manager<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Contribute to the team charter to build and operate a highly scalable and resilient Infrastructure (Network\u002FCompute\u002FStorage\u002FDB).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Introduce and build tools to facilitate greater automation and operability of services.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop SOPs\u002FRunbooks for maintenance and upgrades.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participate in on-call rotation and ensure uptime of services.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Utilize your deep experience and problem-solving skills to help prevent and investigate production issues.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Plan and lead complicated cross functional technical projects within the company.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Contribute as a lead by leading sprint planning, delegating work and assignments to team members and participate in project planning.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>5+ years of experience in a cloud or platform or dev-ops team in a SaaS environment and supporting mission critical services.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in cloud computing AWS(preferred), Azure or GCP.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in building a computer platform on Kubernetes.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with distributed database systems.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with Cloud computing toolsets - <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Solutions Engineering Manager<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> ChargePoint is seeking a detail-oriented Solutions Engineer to work with our automotive, fleet, navigation providers and technology channel partners and customers to build software applications that leverage our technology in the rapidly evolving e-mobility space. This role will be at the forefront to define the next generation of user experience within different types of electric mobility avenues. The Solutions Engineer will work directly with Business Development\u002FSales, Product Management and Engineering to drive the direction of our products to support these key initiatives. The Solutions Engineer will be responsible for building relationships with ChargePoint internal\u002Fthird party developers, creating application examples using ChargePoint APIs and tools, product documentation, and training material, and solve difficult technical integration problems. ChargePoint has a wide variety of partners and customers in this fast-paced industry, and the Applications Engineer will work with Automotive, Fleets, Navigation Providers, and other data partners.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>The Solutions Engineer will work closely with Automotive\u002FFleet\u002FUtility Business Development\u002FSales teams and lead as the technical expert on mainly ChargePoint's software and at-times hardware product packages.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Take on leadership role as customer-facing technical expert for ChargePoint's driver experience technology applications.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Responsible as point person with Product and Engineering teams to define incoming\u002Fnew market requirements and work with internal stakeholders to define roadmap and deliver.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Provide developer support for API integration projects in all areas of the platform.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop technical content and application examples using ChargePoint technology and third-party systems.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Lead technical discussions with ChargePoint engineering and customer engineering staff members to enable integrations with customers.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Leads the maintenance of day-to-day operations of various applications and works with the engineering team to ensure technical issues are resolved on time to meet customer schedules and program commitments.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Leads in the customization and addition of new features to commercial software packages and internally developed applications according to end user requests when needed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Writes and performs tests for applications, fixes problems as they arise, and assists with partner launches.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Writes technical documentation and works with the technical documentation team.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Travel 10-25% of your time for face-to-face meetings with partners and customers.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>8+ years of experience in engineering\u002Fproduct development, ideally in a customer-facing role or mix of business development\u002Fsales engineering<\u002Fli> \n  <li>5+ years of experience writing code.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>High energy, can-do attitude.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficiency with a few common programming languages such as Java, Go, C, C++, C#, JavaScript, PHP, Python, Objective-C, Swift, Ruby, etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Solid knowledge of API standards and protocols such as SOAP, XML, REST, JSON, etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Linux command line experience.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proven track record for solving ambiguous and complex problems.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in automotive\u002Fcommercial vehicle\u002Ffleet\u002Felectric vehicle space.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong evidence in prior roles of bias to action.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>US becoming a reality. ChargePoint is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software, and mobile solutions for every charging need. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities, and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on EV charging and established a business model that's been validated by more than a decade in business and thousands of customers. As now a public company, we remain focused on broadening our market leadership and building on years of innovation. <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Power Electronics Firmware Manager<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> ChargePoint is looking for a creative and versatile <b>Firmware Engineer<\u002Fb> with the ability to develop both hardware and embedded firmware that will meet the challenges presented by the quickly evolving electric vehicle charging industry. This unique individual will help ensure our products solve difficult problems while providing feature rich user experiences that meet high reliability\u002Favailability requirements. The role will play a key cross-functional role to drive many aspects including developing and producing best in class electric vehicle charging systems.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Intimate knowledge of hardware designs including high-speed processors, electro-magnetic systems, and complex sensing circuits.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Create, develop, debug, and maintain embedded algorithms that support complex metering, safety and various functions required to charge electric vehicles.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Deliver firmware optimized for multiple dimensions including mixed signal coding, provably correct algorithms, hard real-time, and low-level bare metal.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of co-operative schedulers, pre-emptive schedulers, and finite state machines.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Support, debug and modify existing embedded control\u002Fsensing algorithms.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work effectively with cross-functional teams to resolve early (architectural) and late (lab, test &amp; validation) issues.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work closely with hardware engineers to test and validate operation on the bench.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Get involved in early hardware design and definition.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Desire to innovate and create new technologies in vehicle charging.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Interfacing with safety agencies such as UL, CSA, ETL, or similar, and proving compliance of own code and architecture.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>5+ years of experience developing embedded code for control and operation of commercial or industrial power equipment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent Embedded C knowledge\u002Fdevelopment experience. Proficient in ARM assembly. Knowledge of embedded Linux a plus.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Peripheral driver development: SPI\u002FI2C\u002FUART\u002FTimers\u002FADCs\u002FCAN bus\u002FOPAMPS\u002FCOMPARATORS\u002FDACs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to interpret mixed signal schematics\u002Fhardware designs and develop firmware based on spec. Experience with OrCad Capture and Allegro development tools a plus.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bachelor's degree or higher in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related disciplines.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Preferred<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li><i>Experience with Software\u002FHardware Safety Standards such as UL 1998, IEC 60730, UL991, ISO26262, DO-178,<\u002Fi> <i>DO-254, or any Class B consumer system such as washing machine or microwave.<\u002Fi><\u002Fli> \n  <li><i>Experience with OrCad Capture and Allegro development tools a plus.<\u002Fi><\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiarity with power conversion topologies such as Buck\u002FBoost and converter control law desired.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with embedded bootloader use and development.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of digital control theory and digital signal processing: filter design and transforms.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of C++<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $60,000 to $121,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.<\u002Fp> \n <p> If there is a match between your experiences\u002Fskills and the Company needs, we will contact you directly.<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer.<br> Applicants only - Recruiting agencies do not contact.<\u002Fp> \n <p>
