<h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>About Us<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.<\u002Fp> \n <p> Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Reports To<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Director of DevOps and Site Reliability Engineering<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Be Doing<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> We're hiring talented Cloud Infrastructure Engineer that is passionate about using software-based approaches to solve complex infrastructure challenges and automate solutions. Working in cloud engineering, you'll lead and contribute to building a modern cloud-native platform on AWS that will improve developer experience, productivity, velocity and optimize operations. Also, will focus on scaling our infrastructure processes, systems, and automation.<\u002Fp> \n <p> You'll build a deep understanding of ChargePoint services and use that knowledge, coupled with your infrastructure experience to optimize and evolve our infrastructure availability, reliability, observability, security, performance and cost. You possess excellent communication, and collaboration skills.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> What You Will Bring to ChargePoint<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Contribute to the team charter to build and operate a highly scalable and resilient Infrastructure (Network\u002FCompute\u002FStorage\u002FDB).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Introduce and build tools to facilitate greater automation and operability of services.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Develop SOPs\u002FRunbooks for maintenance and upgrades.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participate in on-call rotation and ensure uptime of services.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Utilize your deep experience and problem-solving skills to help prevent and investigate production issues.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Plan and lead complicated cross functional technical projects within the company.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Contribute as a lead by leading sprint planning, delegating work and assignments to team members and participate in project planning.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p><b><i> Technical: <\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>1+ years of experience in a cloud or platform or dev-ops team in a SaaS environment and supporting mission critical services.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in cloud computing AWS(preferred), Azure or GCP.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in building a computer platform on Kubernetes.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with distributed database systems.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with Cloud computing toolsets - Terraform, Vault, Packer.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with configuration management tools - Ansible, Chef, Puppet<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with TCP\u002FIP networking and troubleshooting.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong sysadmin background demonstrated knowledge of OS lifecycle management managing complex OS upgrades.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with observability tools Prometheus\u002FGrafana\u002FELK to track metrics, logs and traces.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience and knowledge in building secure CI\u002FCD pipelines using Git, Jenkins, ArgoCD, SAST tools.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong coding skills in Python or Go.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Good knowledge of distributed systems and APIs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Able to debug, troubleshoot, and resolve complex technical issues.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b><i>Execution:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Able to build a tech roadmap based on product requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Able to influence team and the developers to build systems that are production ready<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proposes and drives architectural changes to solve scale and performance issues<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Can lead large cross functional projects and define KPIs to measure success<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b><i>Collaboration and Communication:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Drives Root Cause Analysis (RCA) along with the engineering community.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Works with platform\u002Fengineering teams influencing designs that will improve the overall efficiency and productivity.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Contributes to runbooks and general documentation<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Improves team practices in handoff of work and incidents<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b><i>Influence and Maturity:<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul> \n  <li>Involved in hiring process - involved in interviews and qualifying candidates<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Mentors and Coaches team members<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Able to de-escalate conflicts inside and outside the team<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Writes in-depth documentation that shares knowledge<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Helps develop team members to raise the overall bar<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Location<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p> Campbell, CA<\u002Fp> \n <p> ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.<br> The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $105,000 to $207,000. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location.<\u002Fp> \n <p> We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status,
